Decoration: 2- and 3-line initials at the beginning of each commentary are in red uncials; they are frequently decorated with balls or cross-hatching; 1-line initials are in brown uncials with occasional use of rustic capital forms; the first several words of each commentary are written in brown rustic capitals; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus versus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text; accents were added by a later hand.

record.title: South German Homiliary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule, which Bischoff (on the basis of his inspection of other leaves of the same manuscript) dated to the second quarter of the ninth century.

Decoration: the homily on fol. 1v begins with a 3-line initial "T" outlined in orange and filled and surrounded with brown; 1-line initials are in orange uncials and are set apart from the text between the double vertical bounding lines; punctuated with the punctus and punctus versus.

record.title: Sermons (Alan of Farfa, Homiliary?) (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule, which Bischoff has dated to the first third of the ninth century.

Decoration: the homily begins with a 7-line decorated initial "F" outlined in brown and filled with orange, dark orange, ochre, and olive green; 1-line initials in brown uncials; rubric written in red uncials; punctuated with the punctus and punctus versus; a leaf has been drawn in red in the space between the columns on the verso.

record.title: Ars Laureshamensis, Expositio in Donatum maiorem (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule.
Decoration: 1-line initials are brown rustic capitals; punctuated with the punctus and punctus interrogativus; double quotation marks are within the text.

record.title: De syllogismo categorico, De differentiis topicis (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a highly abbreviated, late Caroline script.

Decoration: 2- and 3-line initials at the beginning of each section are red; 1-line initials are brown rustic capitals; the explicit is written in brown rustic capitals with some use of uncial and minuscule forms; there are nine diagrams, one outlined in red; punctuated with the punctus.

record.title: Sacramentary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: 2-line initials are red rustic capitals with single round "D"; 1-line initials are brown uncials; rubrics written in red rustic capitals; punctuated with the punctus and punctus versus; accents in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Historiae Alexandri Magni (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in rounded gothic bookhand (gothico-humanistica).
Decoration: 1-line initials are brown capitals; there are brief notes on the text written in the margin in a cursive humanistic script of the fifteenth century; punctuated with the punctus.

record.title: Bible, Luke (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: 1- and 2-line initials alternate in red and green uncials; 1-line initials are brown uncials; the running title "Secundum" / "Lucam" is written in brown rustic capitals in the upper margin; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, punctus versus, and punctus interrogativus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text; canon table numbers are written in the left marins in red roman numerals.

record.title: Homiliae xl in evangelia (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in late Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: At the beginning of Homily 4 (fol. 2r) there is a 3-line initial "C" sketched, but not completed, in brown ink with foliate decoration; it may be a later addition; 1-line initials are brown uncials; the rubrics for Homily 4 and its lesson are written in red minuscule mixed with uncial forms, with red line-filler; there are no initials or rubrics for the beginning of each lesson; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text; accents were added by a later hand; on fol. 2v there are three interlinear Latin glosses in a fifteenth-century hand; other fifteenth-century hands have added marginal notations and figures of heads on fols. 7v-8r.

record.title: Passio S. Felicitatis (from a Passionary?) (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in an inelegant Caroline minuscule.
Decoration: 1-line initials are brown rustic capitals; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus versus.

record.title: Homiliae xl in evangelia (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in late Caroline minuscule.
Decoration: 1-line initials are brown uncials; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus; hyphenation in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Homilies (Haimo of Halberstadt?) (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: on fol. 1v there is a very fine 3/4-page decorated initial "I" in red and yellow on a purple, blue, and orange ground, with vine-stem decoration lightly washed with yellow; 1-line initials are either in red rustic capitals or brown rustic capitals highlighted with red; rubrics are written in a mixture of red minuscule and rustic capitals; punctuated with the punctus and punctus elevatus; double quotation marks are within the text; accents are in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Noted Breviary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in two sizes of Caroline minuscule, with a larger script for the lessons and hymn and a smaller script for the antiphons and responses.

Decoration: on fol. 1v there are decorated initials "I" (7-line) and "F" (8-line), outlined in orange and colored with green and yellow ; 1- and 2-line initials are orange uncials; 1-line initials within the hymn are a mixture of orange uncials and rustic capitals; rubrics are written in orange minuscule; interlinear neumes in the St. Gall style; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus; accents and diacritical marks over double "i" by later hands.

record.title: Homiliae (Expositios super Mattheum) (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in late Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: 2-line initial "E" is a red uncial highlighted with yellow; 1-line initials are a mixture of brown uncials, rustic capitals, and enlarged minuscule forms, usually filled with yellow; the rubric is written in red minuscule; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus, some of the last altered from the punctus by a corrector; hyphenation in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Passionary (Passio S. Cassiani) (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Beneventan script.

Decoration: the Prudentius life is written in poetic stanzas; six-line decorated initial is outlined in brown; 1-line initials are brown uncials; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus versus.

record.title: Homiliary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: 7-line initial "L" is in red, the horizontal stroke decorated with two round balls; 1-line initials are brown uncials; rubrics are written in red in the same script as the text, but in a larger module; punctuated with the punctus.

record.title: Homiliary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in late Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: on fol. 1r there is a fine 7-line decorated initial "E" in yellow filled with red geometric penwork on a ground of blue, green, and dark red, with four vine stems originating from the lower bar of the "E"; a guide letter appears in the margin opposite the decorated initial; 1-line initials are black uncials; rubrics written in red uncials; punctuated with the punctus; hyphenation and accents were added by a later hand.

record.title: Bible, Genesis (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in two sizes of gothic bookhand (littera textualis).

Decoration: the preface on fol. 2r begins with a 10-line decorated initial "D" in red interlace on a green geometric ground with a blue ground for the central portion of the vine stem; the text of Genesis begins with a half-page decorated initial "I" in the same style; 1-line initials in the prefatory material are occasionally red; line fillers are in red; rubrics are written in red in the same script as the text; accents added by a later hand; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Bible, Sirach (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a late Caroline minuscule.

Decoration: 3- to 7-line initials are red uncials; 1-line initials are black uncials; chapter headings are written in red minuscule in a larger module; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, punctus versus, and punctus interrogativus; hyphenation added by a later hand.

record.title: Gradual (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a formal gothic bookhand (littera textualis formata), with musical notation in black on a four-line staff in red.

Decoration: the parchment and writing appear to be from the sixteenth century, but the decoration was added in modern times; there is a 2-line initial "U" in blue, green, and purple on a gold ground and containing the figure of an angel striking a tambourine; foliage decorations in the same colors as the initial extend from the initial into the left margin; punctuated with the punctus.

record.title: Breviary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a formal gothic bookhand (littera textualis formata).

Decoration: the 2-line initial "S" at the beginning of the hymn is in olive-green, green, and red with white filigree and is filled with purple, blue, and red foliage decorated with white filigree; the initial is on a gold ground outlined in black and is surrounded by green, blue, and orange foliage that extends into the margin with gold balls; 1-line initials alternate blue and red; rubrics written in red in the same script as the text; punctuated with the punctus, punctus elevatus, and punctus flexus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Antiphonary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a formal gothic bookhand (littera textualis formata).

Decoration: musical notation in black on a five-line staff in red; on the recto there is a 2-line initial "C" in red and blue on a rectangular ground of red and blue penwork; the 2-line initial "E" on the verso and the 1-line initials are black; rubrics are written in red in the same script as the text, but in a smaller module; punctuated with the punctus; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Gradual (or Missal) (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a formal gothic bookhand (littera textualis formata).

Decoration: musical notation in brown on 4-line staves in red; 1-line initials alternate red with brown penwork and blue with red penwork; the 1-line initial at the beginning of the rubric is a blue capital with red penwork, and the rubric is written in in a smaller version of the text script; words and syllables are divided by red horizontal strokes; punctuated with the punctus.

record.title: Antiphonary (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a formal gothic bookhand (littera textualis formata).

Decoration: on the recto there is a 4-line initial "C", in red and blue on a ground outlined in purple and decorated with purple foliage on red cross-hatching; 1-line initials at the beginning of the hymn and the psalm are red; rubrics written in red in the same script as the text; punctuated with the punctus and the comma; hyphenation is in the same ink as the text.

record.title: Gradual (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in gothic script (littera textualis).

Decoration: one 4-line initial "I", the body of which is divided into three columns of blue, blue-grey, and light brown, each column decorated with a different pattern of white filigree; the first letter of the rubric is a blue uncial with red penwork, and the rest of the rubric is written in red; punctuated with the punctus; musical notation is in black on 4-line staves in red.

record.title: The robin book : watching the robins / copyright by H. Boylston Dummer : Rockport, Mass., [circa 1925].
record.note: Signed in by the creator on first and last pages.
Bound with black string and staples.
Some manuscript corrections in pencil.

record.title: A catalogue of the capital collection of coins and medals, in the highest preservation, and beautiful painted glass, of John Ives, Esq., F.R.S. F.S.A. ... [1777].
record.note: Bound with: A catalogue of the entire and valuable library of John Ives, Jun. [London] : Catalogues to be had of the following booksellers; Mr. Dodsley's ... Mr. Robson's ... Mr. Walter's ... Mr. Edwards's ... Mr. Sewel's ... Mr. Owen's ... and at the place of sale, [1777].

record.title: "Glossa Ordinaria" on the Decretals of Gregory IX (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a heavily abbreviated gothic script.
Decoration: running heads, initials, and rubrics in red; some contemporary marginal commentary.

These fragments, which appear to be from the same manuscript, are contained in Zi +156 (Bernhard von Breydenbach, Prefatio in opus transmarine...), in which the fragments are used as front and back endpapers.

record.title: Bible, Matthew (fragment).
record.note: Decoration: initials in red.
Script: written in an unidentified script.
Contained in Zi +237 (Dionysius de Burgo Sancti Sepulcri, Commentarii in Valerium Maximum), in which the fragment has been used as a spine support.

record.title: Liturgical book (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a gothic script.
Decoration: square notation on a four-line red stave.
This fragment is contained in Zi +318 (Johannes Auerbach, Summa de auditione...), around which the fragment is used as a wrapper.

record.title: Doctrinale Puerorum (fragment).

record.title: Liturgical book (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a large gothic rotunda.
Decoration: rubrics in red; square notation on a four-line red stave.
This fragment is contained in Zi 5546 (Constantine Lascaris, ...Symbolum Apostolorum...), around which the fragment is used as a wrapper.

According to scholar Neil Harris, identifiable as the text of a Cisterican or Benedictine Breviary, 4th Sunday after Pentecost. On the front cover the text reads: "hora cene dicere inuitat <,,,> et uenirent quia omnia para <...> a sint alleluia. Benedictus deus" and on the back "Exi cito in plateas & uico <...> uitatis et pauperes ac deb <,,,> es cecos et claudos compelle". For the date, also given that it was still in Italy in quite modern times, can be safely assigned to northern or central Italy in the fifteenth century or very early sixteenth. Though the parchment is old, the binding itself is modern, i.e. early 20th century (just a bit of a falsification, probably done by Martini). The endpapers are on mechanical paper and the edges are not very scuffed. Autograph "J. Martini" of Giuseppe Martini on front paste-down. Manuscript notes (of Martini?) on free front endpaper.

record.title: [unidentified text] (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a secretary hand.

These fragments, which appear to be from the same manuscript, are contained in Zi 5998 (Bernard of Clairvaux, Epistolae...), in which the fragments are used as front and back endpapers and front and back pastedowns.

record.title: Sentences (fragment).
record.note: Script: writtten in an informal gothic with a moderate number of abbreviations.

record.title: Sentences (fragment).
record.note: Script: writtten in an informal gothic with a moderate number of abbreviations. Marginal glosses written in a heavily abbreviated informal bookhand.

record.note: Script: written in two styles of gothic bookhand: a larger gothic for portions spoken by the priest and a smaller gothic for antiphons and responses.

Decoration: one five-line initial in pink with white penwork on gold grounds infilled with multi-colored ivy leaves; full bar border in gold decorated with ivy leaves; seven one- and two-line dentelle initials; rubrics in red.

record.title: Dialogues (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a protogothic bookhand.
Decoration: the fragment is undecorated.

Decoration: Relatively undecorated; some marginal decorative elements including what appear to be floriated notae; remnants of marginal commentary present.

Decoration: one initial in blue and red with penwork extending into the margin; one two-line initial in red with blue penwork extending into the margin.
The fragment was used in the binding of another volume; the verso is damanged with almost complete loss of text.

Decoration: the fragment is undecorated.

record.title: [unidentified religious text] (fragment).

The fragment appears to have been used in the binding of another volume.

record.title: Carpenter's plan for a barn (fragment).
record.note: Two accompanying letters in French detail the Ghent art historian A.L.J. van de Walle's work on the document.
Script: written in a somewhat neat 16th-century cursive hand.
Decoration: the document is undecorated except for a drawing depicting what appears to be the front side of the barn.

record.title: Bible, 2 Corinthians (fragment) and commentary (fragment0.
record.note: Script: gothic bookhand.

Decoration: Fragment 1: five gold bar borders on pink and blue grounds with white highlights, with ivy-leaf extensions, swags, and gold ivy leaves; one two-line initial S in white on gold ground, with minute colored foliage; alternating gold and blue initials; header in alternating red and blue capitals with contrasting penwork.
A large, possibly 10-line initial has been removed from the first fragment and replaced with a patch from another section of the bible.

record.title: Graecismus (fragment).
record.note: Script: written in a heavily abbreviated informal gothic bookhand; marginal annotations written in an abbreviated informal gothic bookhand with cursive elements.
Decoration: rubricated pilcrows; first letter of each verse is highlighted with a single red line running the length of the text block.
The fragment appears to have been used in the binding of another volume, perhaps as a flyleaf; a large flower-like drawing covers the text of the fragment's verso.

record.title: East of Eden, [circa 1968].
record.note: Title page, lower right corner, in orange ink: “84.”

With the armorial bookplate of R.C. Fiske, Nth Walsham.
With label pasted on lower corner of front pastedown: MS RCF206. Also description in Gough catalogue affixed to front pastedown.
Bound in original contemporary full vellum.

Contemporary blue paper boards.

record.note: Title from dealer's description.
Preserved in a red morocco slipcase, with delicate gilt tooling, slightly rubbed.

record.title: Brush up your Shakespeare : from Kiss me Kate / Cole Porter.
record.note: The item was commissioned for the exhibition "'The Poet of Them All': William Shakespeare and Miniature Designer Bindings from the Collection of Neale and Margaret Albert" (Yale Center for British Art, June 16-August 21, 2016).

record.title: Diary of a cattle drive in 1876, 1876-1878.
record.note: Title from cover.

record.title: Book of verses : seria mixta jocis.
record.note: Ownership inscription under title on title page: Frendraught legi.
Annotated on front pastedown in contemporary hand: With some original new poesie.
Annotated in ink on front flyleaf in an eighteenth-century? hand: 12. shill.
Annotated in pencil on front flyleaf in a modern hand with auction information and a note: This volume contains what appears to be the earliest appearance of "Auld Lang Syne" on p. 247.
Binding: contemporary calf, paneled in blind; compartmented spine.

record.title: Collection of tracts related to the murder of Sir Thomas Overbury, [circa 1615-1625].
record.note: Contemporary pagination in the same hand.

Binding: contemporary full brown sheep with triple fillet border in blind. Center gilt stamp of the arms of King James I (later addition?). Spine compartmented with gilt fleurons. Phillipps MS number "3969" on small label in bottom spine compartment.

record.title: Chirograph : between William le Boteler of Warrington and Richard de Culcheth.
record.note: Script: English cursive documentary script.
Both pieces docketed on their versos in two different hands, the first late fifteenth century? and the second eighteenth century?
Both pieces have parchment tags and missing seals.

record.title: Bible (fragment).
record.note: Layout: 2 columns of 31 lines each; in brown ink.
Script: Caroline minuscule.
Binding: modern cloth case, bearing the call number "MS 801 ES".

record.title: Report on the evacuation of persons of Japanese ancestry from the northern California sector, 1942 April-December.
