record.title: The gathered lilies / the illuminations designed by Mrs. Howard Vyse and Miss Fanny Greville ; the original poem by F.H.
record.note: Bound in contemporary dark blue cloth, with title stamped in gold on front cover.

record.title: Blank account book.
record.note: Foliated 5-130; Arabic numerals on versos facing Roman numerals on following rectos.

Binding: contemporary Italian ledger binding with two straps and flap with ties. Titled: "Debitori e creditori" in capital letters at top of front cover; marked with a capital "A" in a circle in center of front cover. Spine title in faded italic hand: "Debitori e creditori."

record.title: [Atelier International Limited]
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

record.title: Account book recording personal expenditures and receipts, 1772 Jan -1775 July.
record.note: In contemporary reversed calf binding, blind-stamped on front and back boards.
With a label in lower left corner on front pastedown: MS RCF49N.

record.title: Account book recording personal expenditure and receipts, 1798 Jan 29-1816 Dec 15.
record.note: Title from front flyleaf: Lady W- Acct. begun Jan. 1798.
Binding: Marble paper boards with leather spine and corners.

record.title: Billhead recording purchases made by H. Rolfe in 1883 for the funeral of John Rolfe Esq., July 17, 1883.
record.note: "London, July 1883. Este. of John Rolfe Esq."

Billhead of W. Dawe & Son recording the purchase of items for the funeral of John Rolfe Esq. on July 17th, 1883 at Nunhead Cemetery. Purchases recorded are of a coffin, hearse and horse pairs, coaches, black hat bands, dues at cemetery, grave digger and 100 memorial cards totalling £34.15.0. Payment recorded on 01/10/84 received by W. Dawe.
"Bought of W. Dawe & Son, cabinet & bedding manufacturers, upholsterers & carpet warehousemen, 171, Upper Street. Islington, N."
"Established 1828. All goods charged at the lowest cash price. From which no discount can be allowed."
"Undertakers and appraisers. Valuations made for administrations."
Completed in pen and black ink.
Penny stamp with image of Queen Victoria affixed to receipt.

record.title: Our trip to Yellowstone, 1934.
record.note: Written in a notebook with “Yale” printed on cover.

record.title: Narrative of a miracle fragment.
record.note: Script: Uncial Sahidic script
Decoration: Some triangular decorations signifying new sections.
Two columns. Some nomina sacra. Black and red ink. One-half page extant. Potential reference to Revelation. Ink is well preserved on recto, but not on verso.
Binding: No extant binding.

record.title: Kitab al-lughah qubtiyah...min as-sirr al makhifyy al-maudu fi hadha'l-huruf: ms. Book of the Coptic language...A treatise on the hidden mystery of letters, in Arabic.
record.note: Script: Fair nasta'liq script.
Decoration: Multiple illustrations of letters with surrounding Arabic commentary.

Laid in: Chronicon of biblical events, ms., in Arabic. Egypt: 1886. Salwat wa tilbat liikhraj ash-shayatin nin nas, ms., Prayers and supplication for the exorcism of demons, by St. Cyril or St. Basil, in Arabic. Egypt: 1886. Use of black and purple ink. Pages are numerated in both Arabic and Coptic numbering systems. Some missing pages. Some numerological charts and calculations.
Binding: 19th/20th century binding.

record.title: Liturgical book fragments.
record.note: Script: Uncial Coptic script with Arabic translation. Black and another faded (white?) ink.
Decoration: Some headpieces on pp. 7-8.

Three different texts or sections of texts: pp. 1r-4v, 4v-7v, 8r-12v. Minimal marginalia. Common use of nomina sacra, with some unidentified figures: KD the presbyter and TB the apostle. Mention of multiple Christian figures.

record.title: Bible: Apocalypse of John.
record.note: Script: Uncial script.
Decoration: Some decoration.
Recto contains Rev 8:8-9:2. Verso contains Rev 9:2-9. Coptic numeration suggest that this is page 304 on the verso. Minor marginalia. Attatched fragment of paper contains some Arabic script.

record.title: Psalmodia.
record.note: Script: Red and black ink.

Coptic numeration suggests that some pages are missing, with some out of order. Contains prayers of thanksgiving, call-and-response sections between the deacon and priest, and stock hymns to "Abba NIM" (34v). Some section titles include "Anaphora of the holy king," "On the pope," "On peace," "Proem of the division."
Binding: Leather and other fabric binding. Contained printed Latin texts in cartonnage. Wax-like floral decoration stamped on center of front and back covers. Use of Arabic texts for binding repairs.

Manuscript notes on inside of front and back covers: “Bohairic Service Book 14th c.” Bookplate: Maisonneuve et Cie Editeurs. A La Tour de Babel. Stamp: Libraire Orientale et [?] Maisonneuve et Cie. Paris, 15 Quai Voltaire. Signature: “W. Earnes,” “Victor H. Palsits, April, 1907.”

record.title: Liturgical texts and doxologies.
record.note: Script: Uncial Coptic script.
Decoration: Rubricated and illuminated.

Pages are not in order. Some repairs to damaged pages. Vol. 1 = Contains titles: "Gospel of Luke" and "Psalm 131." Contains passages from Luke, Acts, John, as well as fragments of a crowning liturgical text. Some exposition on water, blood, and Spirit. Multiple rubrications appear to be intentionally blotted out. Vol. 2 = Emphasis on Anthony, Elijah, Mary, Christ, David, and Solomon. Some pages stuck together. On one page (12v), St. Cyril's name is stricken and replaced by Teoskoros (Dioscorus of Alexandria?).
Binding: Leather binding. Cartonnage in binding contains reused Arabic texts.

record.title: Collection of liturgical texts.
record.note: Script: Uncial script. Multiple scribal hands. Black and red ink.

Some Arabic titles and full pages interspersed. Fragment of an additional Arabic text. Mentions David, Mary, Gabriel, Zechariah. 1v bears similarities to Luke 1:67-80. Some titles include "Psalm," "Gospel of Luke," "Paul: Romans," and "Catholic: 2 John."

record.title: Fragments of Liturgy of St. Basil and Liturgy of St. Gregory.
record.note: Script: Uncial script. Black, red, and green ink. Multiple scribal hands.
Decoration: Some decorations and headpieces.

Contains fragments of Liturgy of St. Basil and Liturgy of St. Gregory. Pages are severly disordered based on internal numeration. Pages are fairly stained with wax. Many versi have extra letters written in the lower right-hand corner. Some pages stuck together. Contains references to a "song of Moses" and other songs. Include praises of Abba Macarius.
Binding: Only front cover survives; marbled and decorated with floral imprints. Cartonnage filling of cover includes pieces of Coptic, Arabic, and Latin literature.

record.title: Euchologion.
record.note: Script: Black and red ink. At least two scribal hands.
Decoration: Six headpieces with geometric decoration.

Coptic text with Arabic translation. Light marginalia and later redactions. Multiple pages have letters on the bottom center of the verso. 43v contains a large pink cross in the margin, as well as red stains.
Binding: 18th-19th century leather binding with leather clasps. Some geometric decoration.

record.title: Coptic Grammar.
record.note: Script: Uncial Coptic script. Purple, teal, and black ink.
Some marginalia and later redactions. 5 leaves excised at the end of MS.
Binding: 19th century leather binding with "Coptic & Arabic Grammars" on spine.

From the collection of Rev. Johann Rudolph Theophilus Lieder (1797-1865). His collection of antiquities was purchased by William Tyssen-Amherst, First Baron Amherst of Hackney, for £200. Note on the inside of the front cover: “This volume contains a set of Coptic = Arabic Grammars. I obtained it from the Rev. Jn. Lieder at Cairo - 16th April 1858.” Contains a stamp from the Allan Library (~1891). Bookplate and de-accession stamp from the London Library, St. James' Square, on the front cover. In use in the London Library at least during the 1920's.

record.title: Dictionary.
record.note: Script: Black and red ink.
Some marginalia and redactions. Contains both Coptic and Arabic numbering systems. Some thematic arrangement and sections of Greco-Coptic words.
Binding: Marbled board binding. Cloth spine. 19th-20th century.

From the collection of Rev. Johann Rudolph Theophilus Lieder (1797-1865). His collection of antiquities was purchased by William Tyssen-Amherst, First Baron Amherst of Hackney, for £200 in 1868. Note on the inside of the front cover: “This is a Coptic = Arabic Dictionary or [Iyllim?] (Scales) as I think Jn. Lieder said a Dictionary of this kind is called. It is a MS Copy of one which has been recently found for one of the Coptic Convents in Egypt. I procured it from the Rev. Jn. Lieder at Cairo -16th April 1858.” Contains a stamp from the Allan Library, a Methodist foreign-language book and manuscript library (~1891). Bookplate and de-accession stamp from the London Library, St. James' Square, on the front cover. In use in the London Library at least during the 1920's.

record.title: Liturgy of the Coptic Jacobites.
record.note: Script: Red and black ink. At least two scribal hands.
Decoration: Illuminations throughout.

Contains the Liturgy of the Coptic Jacobite with Anaphora of St. Cyril, which was originally a 6th century text attributed to Jacob Baradaeus, bishop of Edessa. Some pages missing. Non-alphabetic Coptic numeration reveal that pages are mostly in the 200s. Numeration occurred after emendation of text. Multiple pages are repaired by scraps of other paper.
Binding: 19th-20th century binding.

record.title: Collection of hymns and prayers.
record.note: Script: Black and red ink. Use of Arabic nasta'liq and naskh script. Multiple scribal hands.

Contains hymns to the Virgin Mary and Prayer of Reconciliation to the Son from St. George's Liturgy. Coptic numeration suggests that text is out of order. Multiple texts of varying page sizes bound together. Some redaction and omission. Minimal marginalia.
Binding: 19th century binding.

record.title: Bible: 1 John, Selections.
record.note: Script: Large uncial script. Black ink.
Recto contains 1 John 2:27-3:2, 4:16-20. Verso contains 1 John 3:5-9, 4:20-5:2, 5:4-6. Coptic numeration suggests this leaf is page 178 of MS. Two (potentially four) columns.

record.title: Bible: Genesis.
record.note: Script: Small uncial script. Black ink.
Contains Gen 24:1-14. Coptic numeration suggests this leaf is page 76 of MS. Some marginalia. Parchment has many folds, but is well preserved.

record.title: Great Lent and Easter Lectionary.
record.note: Script: Uncial script.

Contains lectionary readings for Sundays and feast days from the first Sunday of Lent to the beginning of Easter; also contains 13 leaves from the Annual lectionary for the month of Mesori (July-August), calendar of the Coptic Church from 22-27 Paopi (October-November), and leaves from a history of the Alexandrian patriarchs.
Binding: Modern binding (19th-20th century) with the title "Misc. Orient."
Autograph note in front flyleaf: “In this volume are Coptic MSS. Brought from the East in 1819 by the Rev. Robert Moseley Master. They were bound by the British Museum binder for me in 1872. G.P.M.”

record.title: Billhead recording purchases made by J. R. Frederick for the funeral of Henry Frederick Esq., September 9th, 1880.
record.note: "Sept. 9th 1880. J.R. Frederick, Esq.
"To Wm. R. Chandler. Funeral featherman."

Billhead of Funeral Furnishing Warehouse recording the purchase of items for the funeral of Henry Frederick, Esq., September 9th, 1880. Purchases recorded are of a coffin, hearse, removal men and a carriage to Paddington totalling £10.15.0. Payment recorded received on 11.Sept.1880 by W.R. Chandler.
"Funeral Furnishing Warehouse, 14, Bride St., Bristol (removed from 38.) Established 1815."
Completed in pen and black ink.
Includes a Penny Lilac tax stamp affixed to front.

record.title: Grant of exclusive right of burial.
record.note: Cemetery deed describing the purchase of a grave and right of burial for John Mathew Hall for £2/17/0. Dated August 4th, 1862 and signed by James Walker, Chairman. Includes a description of the plot. Blue paper with stamp of payment.

record.title: Memorandum for an inscription to be added to the headstone for John Armitage Brown.
record.note: Completed in pen and ink.
Title supplied by cataloger.
"March 28 1874. to W. Burnett."
"I enclose inscription for erection at Charlton Cemetery [illegible] Collett Nile [illegible] Yours truly G. Cane. John Armitage Brown. Born July 6th 1805 died December 25th 1869."
Affixed by pin: Brown. Sketch of Stone. 1874.

record.title: Receipt for purchase of a grave in the cemetery in Widnes, England, for Henry Dixon.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Completed in pen and ink.

Receipt for the purchase of a grave and right of burial for Henry Dixon for £1/10/0. Dated 10th November 1918. Signed W. Patten, Registrar. Fees included are for excavating of grave, taking up and replacing headstone, tolling bell before funeral and clergy fee.

record.title: Carthusian Psalter with Canticles and Creed.
record.note: Incomplete. Text ends with Psalm 77.
Layout: single columns of 24 lines.
Script: large gothic script.
Decoration: smaller initial in alternate red and blue; 12 historiated initials; full illuminated border to one page with figures of Carthusian monks and an abbot.
Binding: contemporary pigskin over wooden boards; metal clasps, corner pieces and central bosses.

record.title: Bible (fragment)
record.note: Layout: double columns of 22 lines.
Script: large gothic script.
Decoration: burnished gold initials on pink and blue grounds; leafy marginal extensions.
Binding: 14 leaves bound in modern calf; 3 leaves separate.
Byname: Bohun Bible.

record.title: Sextus liber decretalium.
record.note: L1r contains a pecia copyist's notation: "F xviii."
Bifolium formerly used as an archival wrapper.
Layout: Principal text in double columns of up to 30 lines; surrounding commentary in 89 lines.
Script: rounded gothic (two sizes).
Decoration: two historiated initials against burnished gold.
Binding: modern boards.

record.title: Livre du Lancelot du Lac: three miniatures.
record.note: Binding: individually mounted.

record.title: Indenture placing John Dikes into the service of John Morris, joiner.
record.note: "This indenture witnesseth that [John Dikes], one of the poor [boys] of the charity-school [commonly called the Blue Coat School in the Parish of St. Margaret, Westminster, in the county of Middlesex] doth put h[im]self apprentice to [John Morris of the Parish of St. John the Evangelist, joiner] to learn h[is] art, and with h[im] after the manner of an apprentice to serve from the day of the date hereof, unto the full end and term of [seven] years ... And the said M[aster], (in consideration of the sum of [five] pounds paid to [him] ... ) ... shall teach and instruct, or cause to be taught and instructed, finding unto his said apprentice, meat drink apparel, lodging, washing, and all other necessaries ... In witness thereof, the parties abovenamed to these indentures interchangeably have put their hands and seals the [sixth] day of [October], Anno Dom. 17[40] ... [Memorandm. And it is further covenanted & agreed that the sd. Master shall find and provide for his sd. apprentice one complete suite of new cloths both of linnen and woolen at the expiration of the sd. term. John Morris."
"Sealed and delivered (being first duly stamp'd) in the presence of us, [Edmd. Ball, Justinian Ekins]"

At the head of the indenture is an engraved allegorical triptych. The center panel features a depiction of George III. At left, a young female student stands in front of "the Pillar of Faith" and bears a sign reading "And we as mothers of our Israel." At right, a young male student stands in front of "the Gate of Life" and bears a sign reading "In cause of Church & State may we Excell."
Includes a blind-embossed tax stamp.

record.title: Epistolae Paulae et Catholicae.
record.note: Colophon: Hic per scriptore summe genitoris honore / Anglicum suaue dic rogo lector aue.
Text on final verso identified as a spell or incantation in facing note in a later hand.
Title from spine.
Script: English bookhand.
Decoration: Rubricated; running titles and highlighting in red; pen-flourished initials in blue and red.
James Stevens-Cox Library, number 7.
Binding: nineteenth-century full brown morocco, blind stamped, over wooden boards; spine title gilt: Epistolae Pauli et Catholicae.

record.title: Sermon collection.
record.note: Stamp of the Redemptorists of France on verso of second flyleaf.
Folios are numbered 1-324; folios 297-303 are missing. A few other folios misnumbered or skipped.
Marginal notes in at least one contemporary hand.
Script: very small Italian cursive book hand.
Decoration: Rubricated; headings and some passages underlined in red.
Binding: modern binding of tan sheepskin.

record.title: [Notice for permission to open grave for burial].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
"Authority to open grave. Elizabeth Marvin. Sec. G. No. 160."
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave for the burial of Emily Alice Marvin." Signed: Elizabeth Marvin. 37 Ebury St. Eaton Square Pimilico.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: Decline & fall of hoops in the Roman empire : manuscript.
record.note: Bound in contemporary calf.

record.title: [Notice of receipt of grant for grave space in the Charlton Burial Ground].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
"To the Clerk of the Charlton Burial Board."
"Name, Walter C. Massy. Residence, Woolwich."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: [Notice for permission to open grave for burial].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave for the burial of Mrs. Elizabeth Tawe. Signature: Thos. Robt. Richardson. Address, 22 Mulgrave Place Woolwich.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: [Notice for permission to open grave for burial].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave for the burial of Mrs. McCallum. Signature: Robert McCallum [illegible]. Address: Leith Cottage. Maron Road. Charlton.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: [Notice for permission to open grave for burial].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave for the burial of Margaret Kate Wybourn.Signature: Charles Wybourn.. Address: 12 Lovegrove Place. Greenwich.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: Bible: Gospel of Matthew.
record.note: Contains stamp on inside of back cover: "Return to Shelf no. B 8 ex. lib. Loxwood House."
Script: Uncial script.
Decoration: Rubrication.
Black and red ink. Some marginalia. Ink of folios bleeds onto adjacent pages, especially on the first and last pages -- perhaps from water damage. Text on each page covers roughly 192 x 135 mm.
Binding: Modern binding (19th-20th century).

record.title: Discourses.
record.note: Script: Large uncial script.

White Monastery codex ZD, pp. 193-200. Black ink. Most text is well-preserved; some pages are faded. Two columns per page. Lack of decoration/rubrication. Small fragment contains ink, but no discernible letters. Leaf 1, r = Theological exposition concerning the cross and idolatry with a quotation from Ps 97:7. Leaf 1, v = Mentions heaven and the fires of Gehenna. Leaf 2, r = Mentions a mountain or monastery (ptoou), the sea, and potentially an entourage (komitaton). Leaf 2, v = Coptic page numeration: 198. Mentions a king, the Lord, and land, and sin. Also mentions “those who know the apostles say this: 'God [is] in Christ, who reconciles the world to him.' The interpretation of these things...those who hear me a few times in the midst of every crowd.” Leaf 3, v = Mentions a synagogue and a discourse ("I answered, saying to them: 'It is good...'"). Leaf 4, r = Discourse on "lift[ing] up our cross" and endless prayer. Mentions the kingdom of Christ. Leaf 4, v = Mentions the Lord, grace/gift, a procession out, and "the one who made them."

record.title: Canon.
record.note: Script: Large uncial script.

Black ink. Two columns. Recto is well-preserved; verso is faded. Some minor lacunae. The text is from Codex XF of the White Monastery, including text from Shenoute's Canon 6. Recto focuses on the commandment of God, with a reference to the "gospel of God" and "brothers." Verso focuses on God's teaching and Satan.

record.title: Bible: Revelation
record.note: Decoration:

Black, red, and green ink. Some binding repairs with reused Arabic texts. Final half of book suffers from water staining. Coptic numeration = pp. 12-130 + p. 153. ff. 1-5 = Liturgical text, including prayers and praises of bishops. Use of Abba NIM ("Father so-and-so") as a stock phrase that can be filled in by any episcopal leader. Mentions Jerusalem as the metropolis; mentions the Book of Life. Potential title = the chiliographon (thousand-writer?). ff. 6-103 = Revelation (titled: The Unveiling of What He Saw, namely, of John the Evangelist). Rubrication and decorative headpieces to mark off John's seven "letters" to the churches of Asia. Missing pages (via Coptic numeration) = 20, 60, 74-75, 77, 81, 90-100, 121-152. Corresponds to lacking Rev 1:8-11, 7:11-14, 10:1-7, 10-11:1, 11-13, 13:1-14:15, 19:12- 22:21. Some letter headings contain marginalia saying "Answer: ..." = Call-and-response? Coptic marginalia in pencil (f. 58). 104r = "He said this, which testifies to these things, namely, that they will occur and that they are coming soon. Come, Lord Jesus Christ, upon all the saints from age to age. Amen." MS concludes with seven pages (4 ff.) of Arabic text.
Binding: Modern cloth binding (20th century).

record.title: Bible: Isaiah.
record.note: Script: Uncial script. Multiple scribal hands.
Decoration: Rubrication.

Black and red ink. Significant staining on leaves 2 and 3. Fiber backing used to support ff. Folio 1 preserves only one column per side; leaves 2-3 preserve two columns. Folio 1 contains a narrative about grapes, cutting, the Lord of Hosts, Judea (1r); strong drink, a cithara, a psaltery, and wine (1v). Folio 2 contains a narrative about eating and drinking, those whom God remembers, divine judgment (2r); and Isaiah 24:4-15 (2v). Folio 3 contains Isaiah 40:2-20.

record.title: Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica.
record.note: Script: Uncial script. Black and red ink.
Decoration: Some decorative headpieces.

Bound together with: Abu Ishaq ibn al-Assal, Scala Rimata. John of Samannud's Grammatical Preface and Scala Ecclesiastica were originally written in the 13th century. All three texts preserved are Coptic grammatical works, presumably for continuation of the language, which was waning in popularity. According to internal Coptic numeration, first nine pages are missing. Numbered folios = 9-123. Contains chapter divisions (Cpt. = kephaleon). Some sections are alphabetically arranged. Many pages still bound in sections. Severe worming and heavy damage to some pages. Significant staining throughout. Some Arabic marginalia. Some letters excised.
Binding: 17th century binding with stamped or pressed floral decoration. Some worming. Some Arabic script on the back flyleaf.

record.title: Early Christian narrative.
record.note: Script: Uncial script. Black and red ink.
Decoration: Some headpieces and rubrication.

Some rubrication and decoration. Some spots have letters of a different ink -- perhaps a palimpsest. Two columns. References to Theodorus (of Tabennese?). Coptic numeration suggests this is p. 15-16 of its MS. Substantial staining to half of folio. Recto references a presbyter, frank speech, John, Theodo[rus?], and an elder. Verso references [Theo]dorus.

record.title: Theological discourse.
record.note: Script: Black ink. Two scribal hands -- one on recto, one on verso.

Repairs to top of folio; majority of the folio preserved. Significant wax staining on verso. Two columns. Recto = Theological discourse concerning Jesus and the “Day of the Lord.” Also mentions the “poor brothers.” Verso = Theological discourse on women, their dangers to men, and adornment of the body.

record.title: [Notice for permission to open grave for burial].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave Sec. A, No. 427. Signature: Thomas Hay (?) Address: Woolwich.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: Various Coptic fragments.
record.note: Script: Uncial script.
Decoration: Rubrication.

Black and red ink. Significant staining on some fragments. Frag. 1 = Only discernible word is "misfortune" (v). Frag. 2 = Recto contains the Coptic page numeration 15; verso is marked as page 16. r = "his exaltedness...and I was...a laughing thing...for in the...exaltedness...testimony...from...virgin..." v = "tread upon...woman...the king of...was able...woman...was able...up to...the one who..." Frag. 3 = Little extant text. Frag. 4 = Page numeration included: 128. Appears to be a palimpsest, with a nomen sacrum XC ("Christ") mostly faded on recto. r = "from...that...weep and..." v = "and you did not...you should not look at...for we..." Frag. 5 = Little extant text. Frag. 6 = Very stained. Small script. r = "when...when...them...him..." v = No discernible words. Frag. 7 = Text only on recto, but too faded to discern words. Frag. 8 = Recto contains fragment of a title page of a Bohairic liturgical text. r = "people..." v = "...Gabriel the angel proclaimed..." Frag. 9 = Fragment of a Bohairic liturgical text. References liturgical blessing.

record.title: Bible: Psalms.
record.note: Script: Large uncial script.
Decoration: Rubrication. Some decoration of animals -- a leopard-like creature on verso and dog-like creature on recto.

Black, red, green, and yellow ink. Script of verso is faded; recto is well-preserved. r = Fragment of Psalm 23:2-4. "...green...he...my soul. He took the road...the paths of the righteous...his name...walk in the middle of shadow." v = Fragment of Psalm 24:7-9. "the king of...to...the lord...the lord...in the battle...lift..."

record.title: [Notice of instruction for future use of grave in Charlton Cemetery].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.

Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" ... "I hereby give notice, that no burial is to be allowed in the said grave space without an order in writing from me, or my lawful heirs, executors, or assigns. ... Name, George Garman. Residence, 26 Woolwich Avenue. In the presence of J. Petley. Residence, 3 Fairfield Blvd. Charlton."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: Notice for permission to open grave for burial.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave Sec.G, No. 115. Signature: Gregory Brown.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: [Notice for permission to open grave for burial].
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Notice "To the Clerk to the Charlton Burial Board" for permission to open grave for the burial of Miss Sarah Martha Lock. Signature: Thomas Glenton.
"N.B.--This Notice is to be filled in and signed by the Owner of the Grave, his or her heirs, executors or assigns, as the case may require."
Completed in pen and ink.

record.title: Billhead recording receipt of payment of fees for the interment of Edward Bennett, 83 years.
record.note: Completed in pen and ink.
Billhead of Wavertree Churchyard recording the receipt of payment for the interment of Edward Bennett dated 29 May 1941 totaling £/5/5/0 from Messes P. McDougall Co.
Two penny stamps afixed to bottom.

record.title: Hood family pattern book and related material.
record.note: The pattern book is bound in contemporary half leather and marbled boards. The paper is watermarked "BUDGEN 1815."

record.title: [Bible].
record.note: Some marginal annotations in several hands.

Front pastedown and endleaf manuscript waste from a fifteenth-century London court roll. Autograph letter signed from J. Hewlett to Rev. Smith, London, 1812 May 16, commenting on the manuscript as "a great curiosity," tipped in on front pastedown. Manuscript note commenting on the value of the manuscript in terms of laborer's day wages, 1812 November 11, pasted onto recto of front flyleaf. Verso of front flyleaf contains annotation by Thomas Bayly that he has sold "this bible and one old magna charta...warranted to bee perfett," 1629 May 11. Back pastedown and endleaf manuscript waste from a sixteenth-century indenture concerning George Jackson, in English.
Layout: 50-53 lines in 1 column, with the exception of the first prologue, which is 50-53 lines in 2 columns (1-4 l).
Script: very small gothic book script.
Decoration: rubricated. Larger initials alternate in red and blue ink with red or blue penwork decoration.
Byname: Dover Bible.
Binding: sixteenth-century blind-stamped calf over wooden boards; sewn on five bands. Remains of brass clasps.

record.title: [Bible].
record.note: Colophon states that the manuscript was completed on the feast of St. Gregory (March 12).
Script: gothic rotunda book script.
Decoration: Rubricated. Initials in red and blue with extensive red and blue penwork decoration.
Byname: Ellesmere Bible.

Binding: deerskin over beech boards, sewn on five split tawed thongs. Made as a chemise binding with the deerskin extending well beyond the covers (now complete on top edges only). Two catches on upper cover preserved; 10 brass bosses, five on each cover (probably fifteenth century).

record.title: Emil Toepperwein photography studio and personal loan accounts : manuscript.
record.note: Covers stained and worn, damage at bottom costing some text, a few pages torn.

record.title: Journal of survey notes and maps related to the Lander Road in Wyoming, Idaho, and Nevada : manuscript.
record.note: Pasted on the lining paper of the front board is a calendar for 1858

record.title: Specimens of Cryptogamia, Filicales, Musci : British ferns and mosses.
record.note: Title from front pastedown.
Bound in contemporary patterned wrappers (white, gold, and red).

record.title: Report on the Stratton Estate Mines, Cripple Creek, Colorado : manuscript.
record.note: Cover title: The Stratton Estate Mines, Cripple Creek, Colo.
Some leaves folded, 13 leaves with 26 photographs and 9 leaves with fold-out diagrams and maps.

record.title: Can you forgive her : a tale of Scandalberg / by the author of The disgusted, The distrusted, The dishonored and the disreputable one, etc. etc. ; with illustrations by Old Scratch ; in three volumes ...
record.note: Title from title page, which includes pseudo-imprint: "London, Hookey Walker & Co. Bunkum & Co. New York."
Paper is watermarked 1863.
Bound in later half calf and marbled boards.

record.title: Poem about a trip from the Feather River to Sacramento, California in 1853 : manuscript.
record.note: Poem title: Lines suggested by incidents on my way to Sac from Feather River in 1853.

record.title: Letter : to Richard Bull, 1784 July 14.
record.note: Formerly page 1 of an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.title: Note regarding Maria Sibylla Merian's drawings, not after 1806.
record.note: Date supplied by cataloger based on the year of Richard Bull's death.

Formerly page 4 of an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.title: Historia calamitatum and epistolae.
record.note: Script: compressed gothic book script.
Decoration: 2-line initials in red or blue with penwork flourishing in red or purple. Medieval marginalia includes manicules and grotesques.
Manuscript is incomplete (circa 50 leaves missing?). Text opens: id secreto fieret (Historia calamitatum). Text concludes: orationum instantiam confessio[ne]m lau[dis?] (Letter 7).
Binding: modern blind-stamped white leather.

record.title: Receipts in cookery and preserving only : manuscript.
record.note: Title from inside front cover. Back cover contains title inscription for the medicinal recipes written from the end of the volume: "Receipts in Physick and Chirugery."
Binding: Original cardboard wrapper, stitched. Front cover is decorated with calligraphic birds, arranged around an oval containing the inscription "Deborah Taylor. 1693."

record.title: Catalogue of the library collected by the late J.R. Rowntree, Esq. of Stockon-on-Tees, and the late property of his deceased sister Miss Elizabeth Rowntree, of the same place ..., 1843 October / catalogued by William Robinson, bookseller.
record.note: Title from printed title page.
Also with pages printed with headings: History, voyages, travels, Bewick's works, and miscellanies; Poetry and the drama, English; Strawberry-Hill publications; Auctores classici, Gk. et Lat., &c;
Pages erratically paginated in manuscript.
Bound in original limp maroon morocco, lettered 'Catalogue' on front board.

record.title: Cash book recording estate accounts, 1775 Jan 1-1787 Dec 31.
record.note: With ms. title on front cover: Cashbook beginning the 1st Jamuary 1775
Bound in contemporary vellum
With label pasted in lower left corner of front pastedown: MS RCF49K.
Small 20th-century pamphlet laid in: General rules for the Wymondham and District Homing Pigeon Club.

record.title: Legal texts on property and inheritance.
record.note: Script: in several scripts, including a formal administrative script; secretary script; and a simplified version of court hand.
Binding: contemporary limp parchment binding; remains of ties. "Calthrope" lettered on spine in a later hand.

record.title: Inventory of the jewells and plate of Weedon Perry Esq. : late of the parish of Turvill in the county of Bucks : manuscript.
record.note: Title from head of document.
Signed: "by Rich.d Green Citizen & Goldsmith of London."

record.title: Siege of St. Quintin Act III : manuscript, with corrections in the hand of Thomas Sheridan.
record.note: Binding: original marbled wrappers.

record.title: Ramon de Arozarena and Pedro Balguy report on sugar and rum production in Jamaica : manuscript.
record.note: Signed by Ramon de Arozarena and his fellow commissioner, Pedro Balguy, and dated "Habana. 25 de Junio 1828."
The report was published as Informe presentado a la Junta de Gobierno del Real Consulado de la siemprefiel isla de Cuba (1828).

record.title: Lettres de monseigneur Antoine Girard, evesque de Poitiers : à diferentes personnes qu'il conduisait : manuscript.
record.note: Title from head of text.
Seven pages of prayers in a different contemporary hand at the end of the volume.
Binding: contemporary full black morocco, short title in gilt on spine: "Lettres de M. Girard." Edges gilt.

record.title: Anglia Romana, or : a succinct history of Britain, during its subjection to the Roman empire ... : manuscript.
record.note: The text on page 192 refers to A.D. 1722 as "about thirty years agoe."
Notes in pencil in the hand of A. J. Valpy on front endpapers.
Ownership inscription on front pastedown: "William Allnatt, Wallingford, Berks."
Bookplate on front pastedown: "I. I. Allnatt."
Ownership inscription on recto of front flyleaf: "A. J. Valpy, Red Lion, Fleet Street."
Binding: eighteenth-century plain gray boards.

record.title: Riddles : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page: "Riddles. Nov. 15. 1734."
Binding: Original semi-stiff marbled paper covers.

record.title: Mary Hall recipe book : manuscript.
record.note: Titled on recto of front flyleaf: "M. Hall. 1753."
Ownership inscription on front pastedown: "Mary Hall. November the 16th, 1753."
Binding: contemporary quarter calf with marbled boards.

record.title: My courtesy book, circa 1937.
record.note: Title from cover.

record.title: Scottish worthys and Guthries memoirs : manuscript.
record.note: Annotations on front pastedown attributed to Robert Mylne.
Ownership inscriptions of James Woodhall and Thomas Woodhall on recto of front flyleaf.
Presentation inscription on recto of front flyleaf: "R. W. Talbot from Lady Boswell."
Bookplate of Viscount Strathallan (later 17th Earl of Perth) pasted on recto of front flyleaf.
Title from spine tag.
Binding: early eighteenth-century calf; morocco spine tag, gilt. Each cover has circular blindstamp of Boswell of Auchinleck family crest of a hawk and the motto "Vraye foy."

record.title: Commonplace book concerning English history : manuscript.
record.note: Binding: contemporary marbled boards, very worn.

record.title: Under the earth lies the skin ..., not after 1806.
record.note: Title from first two lines of the poem.
Attributed to René de Percy based on manuscript note in a different hand below poem: By [the] Abbé́ Percy échantillon of English.
Date based on the death date of Richard Bull, who owned and likely assembled the album in which this poem was found.

Formerly laid in at page 120 of an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.title: 880-02 Barīqah Maḥmūdīyah fī sharḥ Ṭarīqah Muḥammadīyah wa-sharīʻah Nabawīyah fī sīrah Aḥmadīyah. Al-Jild 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khādimī.
record.note: Title from folio 11b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamd lillāh alladhī jaʻalanā khayr umam, ummah marḥūmah maghfūrah muthābah ghāyata karam wa-mubārakah lā yudrá awwaluhā khayran wa-ākhiruhā min shumūl al-niʻam min faḍl atá min qibali Nabīyinā ʻalayhi al-taḥīyah wa-al-karīm min al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá afḍal rusulih alladhī bi-tabaʻīyatih yufāz bi-saʻādat al-dārayn bal yunāl ilá aqṣá al-riyāsatayn ..."
Secundo folio: al-ḥakīm wa-ṭaʻāmuhum zuqqūm.
15.5 x 26 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 20 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap and grey central medallion on the covers.

In fair ruqʻah naskhtaʻlīq script, in black ink on white paper with the phrases of Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah of al-Birkawī (Birgivı̂ Mehmet Efendi) in red; markings in red; numerous notes and corrections on the margins; many wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.
On the back of the front cover in purple: "ʻAdad awrāq: 169 Jild awwal. 186 Jild thānī. 265 Jild thālith. 620.
On folio 1a: "al-Jild al-awwal min Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah al-Muḥammadīyah lil-Fāḍil al-Khādimī ʻalayhi al-raḥmah."
Folios 1b-3a and 7-9 are blank.
Folios 3b-6b: "Fihris hādhihi al-nuskhah al-Sharīfah" (Table of contents).
On folio 10a: "Brockelmann GaL, Supplement II S.655 15f. Printed Būlāq 1258, Stambul 1318/9."
Text: Folio 10b-folio 179a.
Folios are also numbered in red in Indian numerals: 1-169.

Colophon: "Intahá al-juzʼ al-awwal taḥrīran fī sanat thamān wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf thumma yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-thānī, awwaluhu: al-Ṣinf al-awwal fī munkarāt al-qalb, al-munkarāt al-ṣādirah min al-qalb wa-āfātuh ay al-balīyah al-mutarattibah ʻalayh. Wa-yalīhi al-juzʼ al-thālith, awwaluhu al-khāmis wa-al-thalāthūn min al-sittīn, al-Faẓāẓah wa-ghilẓat al-qalb wa-bihi yatimmu al-kitāb min Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah li-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-Birkawī wa-sharḥuhu li-Ustādhinā Muḥammad al-Khādimī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāhumā wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāhumā. Allāhumma infaʻnā bi-ʻulūmihimā bi-ḥurmat aslāfihimā wa-irfaʻ darajātinā fī aʻlá ʻillīyīn wa-iḥshirnā maʻa al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn. Āmīn. Wa-salām ʻalá al-mursalīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-anā al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr [...] ibn Ḥasan ibn [...] al-shahīr bi-Ḥaqdārʹzādah yassara Allāh lahum al-ḥusná wa-al-ziyādah. Āmīn. Bi-jāh al-Karīm al-Amīn ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon: "The copying of the first part has ended in the year 1208 [1793/1794]. It will be followed by the second part which begins with the first section on the abominations of the heart, that is the abominations that eminate from the heart and its ailments, i.e. the predicament that affects it. It will be follwed by the third part which begins with the thirty fifth of the sixty sections: Rudness and bluntness of the heart and by that the book of Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah [al-Muḥammadīyah] of our master Muḥammad al-Birkawī and the commentary on it by our teacher Muḥammad al-Khādimī is concluded. May God bless their resting place and make Paradise their abode. May God benefit us by their knowledge by the intercession of their predecessors. We beseech God to raise our ranks to the highest hights and to gather us with the prophets, the righteous, the martyrs and the virtuous. Amen. Peace be unto the messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. I, the despised and poor [...] ibn Ḥasan ibn [...] known as Ḥaqdārʹzādah, May God grant them the best end and more. Amen, by the intercession of the Benevolent and Faithful One, May God pray on him and give him peace.

record.title: 880-02 al-Kashf al-mujallī li-kalām al-Minhāj wa-al-shāriḥ al-Maḥallī : manuscript / ʻAlī al-Munīrī.
record.note: Title from folio 5a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Starts with: "... qāʼilīn li-ahlihi wa-al-ḥaqq sāmiʻ: Akhadhnā bi-āfāq al-samāʼ ʻalaykum, la-nā qamarāhā wa-al-nujūm al-ṭawāliʻ zayyana Allāh al-arḍ bi-mawāṭiʼ aqdāmihim fa-al-shifāh tuqbilu khilālahā wa-bi-iḥāṭat aḥkāmihim wa-iḥkāmihim tadhkuru ḥalālahā wa-ḥarāmahā ..."
Secundo folio: kashafa bi-hi al-muʻammá.
15.5 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 16.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In dark brown leather binding with flap and central medallion on covers.

In good naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper with the phrases of the "Minhāj al-ṭālibīn" of al-Nawawī and "Kanz al-rāghibīn" of al-Maḥallī in red; markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a (in a different hand): "Minhāj al-jalīs fī al-fiqh li-Jalāl al-Maḥallī. Ḥamdan li-man rafaʻa al-ʻilm wa-jaʻalahu zīnat al-ḥayāh al-dunyā. Fa-yā ibn Ādam kun mutaʻalliman lā takun jāhilan wa-ijʻal samʻaka wa-baṣaraka ilá al-dīn al-qawīm wa-ijtanib al-maʻāṣī li-anna al-dunyā dunyā faná wa-man ʻalayhā fān fa-unẓur ilá alladhīn maḍū kānū qāʼilīn li-ahlihi ..."

Ends with: "... qāla Ibn al-ʻImād wa-hādhā lā yunāfī ittifāq al-ʻulamāʼ ʻalá anna min aḥkām al-īmān al-ʻazm ʻalá fiʻl al-wājibāt fī al-mustaqbal li-anna maḥalla [then, in a different hand] li-anna maḥalla maḥalla ʻumūm al-ʻilm wa-al-fiqh wa-jāmiʻ maʻānīh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Maḥallī raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb al-Minhāj al-jalīs fī al-fiqh wa-jaʻaltuhu kāmil al-maʻānī wa-kāna intihāʼ [al-intihāʼ] fī sanat 1148, alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-arbaʻūn Hijrīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh dāyim al-salām."

record.title: 880-02 al-Jawāhir al-ʻiẓām fī waqf Ḥamzah wa-Hishām : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir yā karīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī fataḥa aqfāl khazāyin qulūb ahl al-ʻilm wa-al-ʻirfān wa-khaṣṣahum bi-fahm mushkilāt kitābihi fa-ʻabbarū ʻanhā bi-awḍaḥ ʻibārah wa-aṣaḥḥ dalīl wa-burhān wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mabʻūth bi-afḍal al-lughāt min ashraf al-ʻUrbān wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ulī al-riwāyah wa-al-dirāyah wa-al-itqān. Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ḥaqīr al-muqaṣṣir faqīr al-muṣawwir Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī jammalahu Allāh bi-ishrāq al-sirr al-shuhūdī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-ḍammahā al-jumhūr lil-aṣl.
16.3 x 23 cm; written surface: 12.5-13.5 x 18 cm; 30-31 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In readable naskh script, in black ink on white paper with keywords and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a in pencil: "Kitāb fī waqf Ḥamzah wa-Hishām ʻalá al-hamzah wa-maʻahu al-Sakhāwīyah"
On folio 1b: "Hādhihi Nubdhah laṭīfah wa-fawāyid sharīfah fī waqf Ḥamazah wa-Hishām ʻalá al-hamz."

Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Wa-al-maṭlūb mimman iṭṭalaʻa ʻalá hādhā al-taʼlīf an yanẓura fīhi bi-ʻayn al-riḍá wa-al-inṣāf lā bi-ʻayn al-sukhṭ wa-al-ijḥāf wa-in wajada fīhi khaṭaʼ aṣlaḥahu aw ʻayban satarahu wa-an yadraʼa bi-al-ḥasanah al-sayiʼah fa-qad qalla muʼallif an yaslama min al-hafawāt aw yanjwa muṣannif min al-ʻatharāt li-anna al-insān yaḥullu bi-hi al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-nisyān khuṣūṣan fī hādhā al-zamān alladhī kathurat fīhi al-shawāghil wa-al-humūm wa-ʻaẓumat fīhi al-qawāṭiʻ wa-al-ghumūm, nasʼalu Allāh an yunajjīnā min āfātih wa-an yaqīnā min tabiʻātih wa-an yumītanā ʻalá ḥifẓ Kitābih wa-an yuwaffiqanā li-ḍabṭihi wa-ṣawābih wa-an yamanna ʻalaynā wa-ikhwāninā bi-al-mawt ʻalá al-Islām wa-an yulḥiqanā bi-mashāyikhinā al-bararah al-kirām wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻihi yawm al-Ithnayn khāmis wa-ʻishrīn Shawwāl sanat thamāniyah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah 1168."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God on finishing [the book]. It is requested that those who look into this composition to judge it with compassion and justice not with discontent and prejudice and if they see in it any mistake to correct it, or a blemish to cover it and to hide the bad with the good because no author is immune from making mistakes or writer from shortcomings because human beings are prone to mistakes and forgetfulness specially in this time in which concerns and worries have increased and calamities and sorrows are enormous. We ask God to deliver us from its disasters and to protect us from its implications and that we die protecting His Book and to grnat us to be able to keep it safe and sound and that He may make us and our brethren die as Muslims that we may follow in the path of our rightious and honorable masters. There is no power nor might except in God the most high and the most exalted. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the seal of the prophets and messengers and on his family and all his companions. Amen. The composition of this book was completed on Monday the twenty fifth of Shawwal, the year 1168 of the Hijrah [4 August, 1755]."

record.title: 880-02 Risālah fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ : manuscript / Mūsá al-Sūsī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi nubdhah laṭīfah tataḍammamu aqsām al-waḍʻ maʼkhūdhah min risālat al-ʻAḍud wa-sharḥihā lil-Samarqandī maʻa ziyādah min ḥāshiyat ustādhinā al-Ḥifnī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-mā zīda ʻuziya li-qāʼilih rattabtuhā ʻalá muqaddimah wa-taqsīm wa-khātimah ..."
Secundo folio: ʻāmmatan aw laḥaẓa al-wāḍiʻ.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 17 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with headings in red; some notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ taʼlīf al-ʻallāmah wa-al-muḥaqqiq al-fahhāmah Shykhunā al-Shaykh Mūsá al-Sūsī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. M."
Colophon: "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Ghafara Allāh li-muʼallifihā wa-kātibihā wa-qāriʼihā wa-lil-Muslimīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "It is finished by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence. May God forgive its author, its copyist, its reader and Muslims. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe.

record.title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Nūbī.
record.note: Title from colophon (folio 61a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit missing, starts with: "... fī al-aḥkām al-khamsah allatī hiya al-ījāb wa-al-nadb wa-al-ibāḥah wa-al-karāhah wa-al-taḥrīm wa-ammā al-bāb al-thālith min abwāb uṣūl al-fiqh fa-huwa al-ʻāmm wa-al-khāṣṣ wa-yudhkaru fīhi al-muṭlaq wa-al-muqayyad wa-al-muḥtamal wa-al-mubayyan wa-al-ẓāhir wa-al-muʼawwal wa-qad ittafaqa al-ʻulamāʼ ʻalá anna al-ʻumūm min ʻawāriḍ al-alfāẓ ḥaqīqah wa-fī al-maʻná aqwāl aṣaḥḥuhā annahu ḥaqīqah ayḍan li-anna al-ʻumūm fī al-lughah huwa al-shumūl ..."
Secundo folio: ʻabīdī wa-mā khālafū.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 10 x 14 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Both covers are missing.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with the phrases of the "Waraqāt" and markings in red; some notes on the margins; some corrections on the margings; catchwords.

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt fa-asʼalu Allāh Rabb al-Araḍīn wa-al-samāwāt an yanfaʻa bi-hi ka-mā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi innahu samīʻ qarīb mujīb al-daʻawāt. Qāla muʼallifuhu, ghafar Allāh la-hu: Wa-kāna dhālika ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi aḥqar al-makhlūqāt Aḥmad al-Nūbī, ghafara Allāh la-hu mā iqtarafahu min al-dhunūb wa-al-zallāt fī awākhir shahr Rajab al-fard min shuhūr sanat arbaʻīn wa-alf. Khatama Allāh aʻmālanā wa-aʻmāl al-muʼminīn bi-al-ṣāliḥāt. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God, May He be exalted, facilitated of "Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt." I beseech God, the Lord of heaven and earth that we benefit from it as we benefited from its origin; He listens and readily answers the invocations. Its author, May God forgive him, said: The book was written by its compiler, the most despised of creatures, Aḥmad al-Nūbī, May God forgive him what he commited of sins and shortcomings, at the end of the month of Rajab al-Fard of the year 1040, May God conclude our deeds and the deeds of the believers with righteousness. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: Selections from the mammalia and ornithology volumes of The naturalist's library : manuscript.
record.note: Both volumes bound in contemporary dark green pebble-grained cloth, with leather spine labels. With Longstaff's embossed armorial stamp, on blue paper, on the front pastedown of each volume.

record.title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá ashraf al-mursalīn Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu rājī ʻafwa al-Raʼūf ʻabduhu Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻarī ṭarīqatan al-Saʻdīnī baldatan qad ikhtaṣartu jumlat Aḥādīth min kalām al-Muṣṭafá ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam tabarrukan bi-hi wa-in kuntu lastu min ahl hādhā al-maqām wa-lākin qad yukramu al-ṭufaylī fī maḥall al-kirām wa-ʻazawtu kull Ḥadīth li-rāwīhi wa-kull qawl li-qāʼilihi wa-nabbahtu ʻalá al-Ḥadīth al-ṣaḥīḥ wa-al-marfūʻ wa-al-mawqūf ..."
Secundo folio: aw mawqūfan aw munqaṭiʻan.
17 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound, in fifty numbered quires.
In good and clear naskh script, in black ink on white paper with keywords and markings in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb ka-mā akhbara bi-dhālika al-ṣādiq al-maṣdūq ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-ʻalá ālihi al-aʻlām. M.M.M. taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Saʻdīnī baldatan al-Ashʻārī ṭarīqatan taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn".

On folio 497b an endowment statement: "Waqafa wa-ḥabasa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr al-muqirr bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Yāsīn Makhlūf ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-jaʻala al-naẓar fīhi li-awlādihi baʻda wafātihi lā yubāʻu wa-lā yūhabu wa-lā yurhanu fa-man baddalahu baʻda mā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāh samīʻ ʻalīm. Kātibuhu al-faqīr Ḥusayn Saʻfān shākiran lillāh al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻlá kull ḥāll. Tamm."

Colophon (folio 496b-folio 497a): "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi faqīr ʻafw rabbihi Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Saʻdīnī baldatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻārī ṭarīqatan. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-karīm bi-jāh Muḥammad ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam an yajʻalanā wa-mashāyikhinā wa-muḥibbīnā wa-kātib hādhih al-nuskhah maʻa alladhīna anʻama Allāh ʻlayhim min al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn wa-ḥasuna ulāʼika rafīqan wa-an yasturanā bi-sitrihi al-jamīl wa-an yuyassira lanā umūranā maʻa al-rāḥah li-qulūbinā wa-abdāninā fa-innahu mujīb al-duʻāʼ wa-lā yaruddu man qaṣadahu wa-iʻtamada ʻlayhi wa-fawwaḍa amarahu ilayhi. Wa-qad tawassalnā fī qabūl duʻāʼinā bi-jāh Rasūl Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam li-qawlihi ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Tawassalū bi-jāhī fa-inna jāhī ʻinda Allāh ʻaẓīm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Jumʻah ʻishrīn shahr Rabīʻ Awwal sanat 1293 (GhRJṢ) alf wa-miʼatayn thalāthah wa-tisʻīn baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-azká al-taḥīyah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon (folio 496b-folio 497a): "This book is concluded by the praise of God the Benevolent King at the hand of its compiler Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Saʻdīnī (by town), al-Shāfiʻi (by school), al-Ashʻarī (by Ṣufī order). We beseech God by the exalted status of Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace, to gather us, our masters, our loved ones and the author of this copy with those whom God favored of the prophets, the rightious, the martyrs and the virtuous (What good companions those are!) and to protect us with his pleasant cover and to facilitate our matters with rest to our hearts and bodies because He answers invocation and does not turn back he who seeks Him, depends on Him and consigns himself to Him. We beseech God to accept our invokation by the status of the Messenger of God, May God pray on him and grant him peace beause he said: Beseech God in my status because my status is exalted with God. The writing of this book was concluded on Friday the twentieth of the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, the year 1293 (GhRJṢ [in alphabetical rconning]) of the Prophetic Hijrah, the best of prayer and peace and the most fragrant greetings be upon its originator. May God pray on our master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is concluded.

record.title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
record.note: Title from title page.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ḥāfiẓ Abū ʻĪsá Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn Sūrah al-Tirmidhī: Bāb mā jāʼa fī khalq Rasūl Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam ḥaddathanā Abū Rajāʼ Qutaybah ibn Saʻīd ʻan Mālik ibn Anas ..."
Secundo folio: Sufyān ibn Wakīʻ.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper with headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Shamāʼil lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ al-ruḥalah al-Tirmidhī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn sūrah ibn Mūsá ibn al-Ḍaḥḥāk al-Sulamī aḥad al-aʼimmah alladhīn yuqtadá bihim fī ʻilm al-Ḥadīth, kāna yuḍrab bi-hi al-mathal, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn".
On folio 1a: Table of contents in 35 chapters.
Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-kāna min sīratihi fī juzʼ al-ummah īthār ahl al-faḍl bi-idhnih wa-qismuhu ʻalá qadr faḍlihim fī al-dīn ..."

record.title: Letter : to George Augustus Frederick, Prince of Wales, 1796 May 6.
record.note: Signed "C" and dated "6 Mai 1796" on p. [3].
Trimmed annotation in English on p. [4]: Queen Caroline letter to [the] [...?].
Watermark, partially trimmed: C. Wil[...?] 180[...?].

Formerly laid in at page 173 in an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].
Transcription and translation of letter printed in: Huish, R. Memoirs of Her late Majesty Caroline, queen of Great Britain ... London, Printed for T. Kelly, 1821, v. 1, pages 78-9.

record.title: Character of Queen Caroline, not after 1806.
record.note: Title written at top of p. [1].
Date supplied by cataloger based on the year of Richard Bull's death.

Formerly laid in at page 184 in an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.note: Title from manuscript note in English at bottom of sheet.
Possibly from 1806, the year that Hortense became Queen of Holland and the year of death for Richard Bull, who owned and likely assembled the album in which this poem was found.

Formerly laid in at page 196 in an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.note: Date based on death date of Richard Bull, who owned and likely assembled the album in which this letter was found.

Formerly laid in at page 201 in an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.title: Lines in mosoleum at North Court, not after 1806 / by Mr. Bull.
record.note: Title written in ink and pencil in a contemporary hand on verso.
Statement of responsibility written in pencil in a contemporary hand on verso.
Date supplied by cataloger based on the year of Richard Bull's death.
Pencil annotation in a later hand on verso: V[...?] extracts[?] Mrs. B.
Watermark: Joseph Coles 1805.

Formerly laid in at page 209 in an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.title: To Richard Bull Esq. this is most gratefully presented by his obedient humble servant Thos. Bayles, not after 1806.
record.note: Date based on death date of Richard Bull.

Formerly laid in at page 211 in an album containing 402 pages, bound in red morocco leather with single gilt ruled line; spine stamped in gold "Drawings." Now disassembled and matted separately: Bull, R. Scrapbook of drawings. [England], [not after 1806].

record.title: Preliminary explanation of the accounts and statements submitted to the creditors : manuscript / by S. M'Gillivray.
record.note: Title from caption.

record.title: Charter granted by Edward VI to the burgesses of Devizes.
record.note: Date from end of document: the xxvii daye of Novembre in [th]e fyrste yeare of ow[r] kynge.
Annotation on front flyleaf by "J.W." (James Waylen?) identifying the charter; further annotation in a later hand on pasted-in slip.
Layout: single columns of 18 lines.
Script: secretary.

Binding: manuscript parchment leaf containing a portion of the Epistle for Mass in Holy Week (Isaiah 62:11-63:7?) and the text of the Gradual ("Et ne auertes facien tuam"). Staves with musical notation; initials in red and blue penwork.
Binding: full red morocco, gilt, folder-type binding. Title on front cover: Devizes Charter. Edward VI. 1649 [sic].

record.title: A mite cast into the treasury of the famous city of London : manuscript.
record.note: Title from first page.

Full text published as: A mite cast into the treasury of the famous city of London, being a brief and methodical discourse of the nature, causes, symptomes, remedies and preservation from the plague, in this calamitous year, 1665 / digested into aphorismes, by Theophilus Garencieres (London: 1665).

record.title: De febribus : manuscript
record.note: Title from title page.
Binding: full polished calf, rebacked. Spine title, gilt: "17th century medical ms."

record.title: Narrative of Mr. Allen's transactions with the government : for the better management of the bye-way and cross-road posts : manuscript.
record.note: Title from title page.
Binding: contemporary marbled boards; paper label on front cover: "A Narrative."

record.title: Samuel Noyes diary : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Accompanied by a 19th-century typescript carbon transcript prepared by T. H. Noyes.
Binding: original wallet-style parchment with tongue-flap closure.

record.title: Greek grammar notebook : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Binding: original paper wrapper. "Gram. Greco" written on front wrapper.

record.title: Jean Léon de Métivier poems : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Binding: 18th-century half calf over blue-green paper boards; edges in blue.

record.title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī. Inna al-Qiddīs Afrām kāna min jins al-Suryān ayḍan min madīnat Nuṣaybīn wa-ummuhu min madīnat Umīd wa-abūhu kāna ḥabran fī Nuṣaybīn yakhdumu ṣanam ismuhu Īnīl dhāka alladhī hadamahu al-Malik al-ẓāfir Badbiyānūn fī ayyām al-Malik Qusṭanṭīn al-ẓāfir al-muʼmin al-ḥaqīqī ..."
Secundo folio: fa-al-niʻmah al-ilāhīyah raʼafathu.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound; 1 quire (49 numbered pages).
In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink on aging white paper.

Colophon: "Qad tammat qiṣṣat ḥayāt al-Qiddīs al-ʻaẓīm wa-al-ṭūbāwī Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī wa-al-muʻallim al-Ilāhī bi-qalam mutarjimihā min al-lughah al-Suryānīyah ilá al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah Buṭrus Rizq al-ʻAndārī aḥad talāmidhat Madrasat Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn wa-kāna dhālika fī al-dayr al-madhkūr fa-yarjū ghaḍḍ al-naẓar min kull labīb wa-adīb ʻammā faraṭa minhu al-khaṭaʼ siwá kāna min al-imlāʼ am min tarkīb al-jumal fa-subḥān man huwa maʻṣūm faqaṭ. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kutayyib fī 17 K 2 [Kānūn al-Thānī] sanat 1895 Masīḥīyah. Fa-Allāh yuʻṭīnā an naʻīsha ka-hādhā al-Qiddīs al-ʻaẓīm wa-natamaththal wa-naqtadī bi-ḥayātihi al-mamlūwah qadāsah. Fa-hādhā mā aṭlubuhu wa-atamannāh bi-shafāʻat Sayyidat al-ʻĀlamīn wa-bi-ṣalāt al-ṭūbāwī Mārī Afrām wa-Mārī Mārūn wa-Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn wa-jamīʻ al-qiddīsīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "The biography of the great blessed and divine teacher Saint Ephrem the Syrian is completed by its translator from Syriac into Arabic Buṭrus Rizq al-ʻAndārī, a student of the School of Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn at the mentioned monastery. He requests from any intelligent and learned reader to disregard any mistake in spelling or sentence structure. Glory be to the Only Infallible One. This booklet was concluded on 17 January 1895. May God grant us to live according to the example of this great saint and emulate his holy life. This is what I am asking and hope for through the intercession of Our Lady and the prayers of the blessed Saint Ephrem, Saint Mārūn, Saint Yūḥannā Mārūn and all the saints. Amen."

record.title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Naḥmaduka Allāhumma yā man tafarrada bi-al-ījād wa-al-taʼthīr wa-taqaddasa ʻan al-sharikah wa-al-ʻanād fī ʻumūm al-ikhtiyār wa-al-taqdīr wa-nuṣallī wa-nusallimu ʻalá man jabara ʻulamāʼ ummatihi bi-amdādihi fa-iktasabū min asrār ḥikmatihi wa-qāmū bi-amr Allāh bayna ʻibādih ..."
Secundo folio: jazā Allāh ʻannā kull ḥabr.
17 x 24 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white aging paper with some markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhā Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn taʼlīf al-shams al-munīr Shaykhunā al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-mashhūr bi-al-Amīr nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak min shahr Ramaḍān al-mubārak alladhī huwa min shuhūr sanat 1215. Wa-al-ḥamd lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓīm. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Bukhārī ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-uṣūl uṣūlih wa-furūʻ furūʻih."

Translation of the colophon: "The writing of this treatise was concluded on blessed Monday in blessed Ramaḍān, 1215. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. There is no power nor might except in God the most high and the most powerful. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the illiterate prophet and on his family and companions and grant them peace. [Copied by] Muḥammad Aḥmad ʻAlī ʻĪsá al-Bukhārī. May God forgive him and the origins of his origins and the branches of his branches."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā sharḥ laṭīf li-manẓūmatī al-kubrá allatī fī manāzil al-qamar. Wa-hādhā awān al-shurūʻ fī al-maqṣūd fa-aqūlu mustaʻīnan billāh ..."
Secundo folio: thamānī wa-ʻishrūn li-annahu.
12.5 x 18.2 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 15 cm; 18 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper with the phrases of the original in red; catchwords.

On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-Qamar ʻafá Allāh ʻan muʼallifihā Imāminā al-muḥaqqiq al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihi. Āmīn. ʻĪsá Muḥammad al-Bukhārī. Sanat 1220 Hijrīyah."

Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Intahá mā wajadtuhu bi-khaṭṭ Shaykhinā waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi al-ʻallāmah al-fāḍil wa-al-ʻumdah al-kāmil fasaḥ Allāh fī muddatihi wa-abqāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamma naskh hādhihi al-risālah min nuskhat muʼallifihā al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī ʻalá yad rājī ʻafwa al-Bārī ʻĪsá Muḥammad Aḥmad ḥafīd al-Ustādh ʻAlī al-madʻū bi-al-Bukhārī nafaʻanā Allāh bihim. Āmīn. Tammat."

Translation of the colophon: "God knows the truth better. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master and Lord Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. Concluded is what I found in handwriting of our teacher the unique of his time and the distinguished of his era the virtuous scholar and the perfect authority, may God prolong his life, protect him and benefit us and the Muslims by him. Amen. The copying of this treatise was done from the copy of its author Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī by the hand of him who hopes for the forgiveness of the Creator ʻĪsá Muḥammad Aḥmad the grandson of the teacher ʻAlī called al-Bukhārī, may God benefit us by them. Amen. It is concluded."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Sālim al-Ḥifnī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī kammala bi-sharaf al-waḍʻ shaʼn al-aʻlām wa-jammala ḍamāʼirahum bi-idrāk asrār afṣaḥ al-kalām wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-mawṣūl bi-hi ajmal al-maʻārif wa-al-maqṭūʻ bi-annahu akmal maṣdar lil-faḍāʼil wa-al-laṭāʼif wa-ʻalá ālihi al-abrār wa-ṣaḥbihi al-akhyār ..."
Secundo folio: jāyiz ka-dukhūlihā bi-ittifāq.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; numerous notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ḥifnī al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq al-ʻālim al-mudaqqiq ḥafiẓahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 40b a crossed through statement: "Qūbilat ʻalá nuskhat al-muʼallif fa-ṣaḥḥat in shāʼa Allāh taʻālá."
Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh al-muwaffiq lil-ṣawāb wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-al-āl wa-al-aṣḥāb wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."
Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God the conciliator to the truth. May abundant prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad and his family and companions."

record.title: 880-01 Laṭāʼif tataʻallaqu bi-masʼalat al-waḥdah al-qāʼilīn bi-hā ahl al-maʻārif : manuscript.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Bismillāh bidāyatan wa-nihāyah wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh riwāyatan wa-dirāyah wa-uṣallī wa-usallimu ʻalá al-awwal wa-al-ākhir al-bāṭin wa-al-ẓāhir wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-rātiʻīn fī basātīn al-ẓāhir. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi Laṭāʼif tataʻallaqu bi-masʼalat al-waḥdah al-qāʼilīna bi-hā ahl al-maʻārif ..."
Secundo folio: ʻan al-aʻyān wa-al-maẓāhir.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 15.5 cm; 17 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with headings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Fa-hādhihi Laṭāʼif tataʻallaqu bi-masʼalat al-waḥdah al-qāʼilīna bi-hā ahl al-maʻārif."

Colophon: "Ḥaqqaqanā Allāh bi-dhawq dhālik wa-salaka bi-nā fī aḥsan al-masālik wa-ṣallá Allāh wa-sallam ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-fātiḥ al-khātim wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih wa-atbāʻihim fī jamīʻ al-ʻawālim. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "May God make us worthy to savor that and guide us to the best of paths. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad the victorious and the seal [of the prophets] and on his family and companions and their followers in all places. Āmen."

record.title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. Qāla al-Shaykh al-Imām Abū Muḥammad Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Ruʻaynī thumma al-Shabāṭī [al-Shāṭibī] raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-ʻan wālidayhi wa-nafaʻanā bi-mā qaraʼahu wa-quriʼa ʻalayhi wa-jaʻala al-khayrāt tuʻlanu bi-hi ..."
Secundo folio of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": wa-hāka naẓma alladhī.

Incipit of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn ʻalá al-qawm al-kāfirīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāhi wa-ṣallá wa-sallama // ʻalá alladhī jalā ʻani al-qalabi al-ʻamá. Muḥammadin khayri al-anāmi al-hādī // ilá sabīli al-ḥaqqi wa-al-rashādi ..."
Secundo folio of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "Man lam yujawwidʹhu min al-jamāʻah.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 16 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with headings in thick script tinted in red; catchwords.
At head of folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Rāʼīyah."

Colophon of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "Najazat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād al-ḍuʻafāʼ Muṣṭafá najl al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ḥāwī al-faḍāʼil al-Shaykh ʻAlī Fayyāḍ al-Balqaṭrī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-lil-qāriʼ wa-al-mustamiʻ wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-muqaddimah al-Rāʼīyah fī rasm al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm taʼlīf Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Shāṭibī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min nafaḥātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah fī 26 Rabīʻī [Rabīʻ] al-Thānī min shuhūr sanat 1071, ghafara Allāh li-nāẓimihā wa-lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "The treatise was concluded by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest and weakest of the servants al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ḥāwī al-faḍāʼil al-Shaykh ʻAlī Fayyāḍ al-Balqaṭrī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him and his parents and them who invoke God on his behalf to forgive him. May God forgive also the readers and listeners and all Muslims. Concluded is the copying of "al-Muqaddimah al-Rāʼīyah" on the orthography of the glorious Qurʼan, by Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Shāṭibī, May God benefit us by his blessings and encompass us by his grace in this world and in the hereafter, on 26 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1071. May God forgive its author and all believers, men and women, and all Muslims, men and women, the living among them and the dead. Amen. Amen. Amen."

Colophon of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Kātib al-khaṭṭ Muṣṭafá ibn Qāsim, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ ..."

Translation of the colophon of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "The copying of the treatise was concluded by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence, by Muṣṭafá ibn Qāsim, May God forgive him and his parents and all ..."

record.title: 880-02 Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāʼir : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Sibṭ al-Māridīnī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn wa-raḍiya Allāh ʻan al-ṣaḥābah wa-al-tābiʻīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-hādhihi muqaddimah awradtu fīhā mā yajibu istiḥḍāruhu li-man yabtadiʼu fī ʻilm al-mīqāt, fa-aqūlu al-nuqṭah shayʼ min dhawāt al-aḍlāʻ lā juzʼ la-hu ..."
Secundo folio: yaʻnī nihāyātihā wa-al-shakl.
14 x 21 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; some markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Laqṭ al-jawāhir fī maʻrifat al-khuṭūṭ wa-al-dawāyir li-Sibṭ al-Mārdīnī ʻafá Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn."
On the upper right margin of folio 5b: "Balagha muqābalatan [Fully collated]."

Ends with: "Wa-iʻlam annī aṭlaqtu lafẓ al-ufuq hunā wa-murādī bi-hi al-ufuq al-ḥaqīqī lā al-marʼī wa-fīhi baḥth dhakartuhu fī risālatī al-musammāh bi-al-Maṭlab. Wa-Allāh subḥānuhu wa-taʻālá aʻlam wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

record.title: 880-02 Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alladhīna iṣṭafá. Hādhā juzʼ laṭīf tarjamtu fīhi al-Imām Mālik ibn Anas raḍiya Allāh ʻanh sammaytuhu Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik ..."
Secundo folio: wa-qala al-Zubayr ʻidāduhu.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 17 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Jalāl al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakatih. Āmīn." "Wa-yalīhi Inbāh al-adhkiyāʼ bi-ḥayāt al-anbiyāʼ la-hu ayḍan. Wa-yalīhi Bushrá al-labīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb la-hu ayḍan." (These two titles are not in the present manuscript).
