Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-kitāb wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-imām al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam muddata dhikr al-dhākirīn wa-sahw al-ghāfilīn ṣalātan dāʼimah mustamirah ilá yawm al-dīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the book. Praise be to God in all matters. God suffices us. He is the best advocate. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, the seal of the prophets and the leader of the messengers, and on his family and companions and grant them peace as long as He is remembered by those who remember and by those who are negligent, a continuous and permanent prayer until judgement day. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-muḥtāj fī qiṣṣat al-isrāʼ wa-al-miʻrāj : manuscript / Yūsuf Fakhr.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.
Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā // li-dīnihi al-qawīmi wa-irtaḍānā ..."
Secundo folio: fa-iḥtamalūhu thumma jāʼū.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper; extensive commentaries and explanations on the margins and interlinear; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat Kifāyat al-muḥtāj fī qiṣṣat al-Isrāʼ wa-al-miʻrāj taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-ḥabr al-baḥr waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wālidī wa-malādhī wa-sayyidī wa-sanadī al-Shaykh Yūsuf Fakhr raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."
On folio 1b: "Lakhkhaṣtuhā min 'Qiṣṣat al-Isrāʼ' lil-ʻĀrif al-Ghayṭī muḥyī al-Sunnah."

Ends with: "Wa-nasʼalu Allāh subḥānahu wa-taʻālá an yuʻīnanā ʻalá dhālik wa-an yasluka bi-nā aḥsan al-masālik wa-an yumattiʻanā bi-al-naẓar ilá wajhika [wajhihi] al-karīm fī dār al-qarār wa-an yudīma ʻalaynā niʻmat al-Islām wa-an yaḥshuranā fī zumrat Nabīyihi ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-an yashghulanā wa-yastaʻmilanā bi-mā fīhi riḍāh wa-an yajʻlanā min ahl 'Lā ilāha illā Allāh Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh'. Tamm."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Fiqh al-akbar : manuscript / Abū al-Muntahá Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Maghnīsāwī.
record.note: Title from reference sources and folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Kitāb Abū al-Muntahá raḥmat Allāh ʻlayh. Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī hadānā ilá ṭarīq al-sunnah wa-al-jamāʻah bi-faḍlihi al-ʻaẓīm wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá rasūlihi wa-ḥabībihi Muḥammad alladhī kāna ʻalá khuluq ʻaẓīm wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi al-dāʻīn ilá ṣirāṭ mustaqīm. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib Abū al-Muntahá ʻaṣamahu Allāh taʻālá al-kabīr al-karīm ʻan al-khaṭāyā wa-al-maʻāṣī wa-min al-iʻtiqād al-fāsid al-ʻaqīm inna kitāb al-Fiqh al-akbar alladhī ṣannafahu al-Imām al-aʻẓam kitāb ṣaḥīḥ ... fa-ardtu an ajmaʻa kalimāt min al-Kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-min al-kutub al-muʻtabarah ḥattá takūna sharḥan li-hādhā al-kitāb al-sharīf al-laṭīf ..."
Secundo folio: bi-mashīʼat Allāh taʻālá.
15 x 21 cm; written surface: 6 x 15.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair medium naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink on white paper with markings in red; extensive commentaries on the margins; many wormholes on the margins with some loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1b: "Kitāb Abū al-Muntahá raḥmat Allāh ʻlayh."

Colophon: "Tammat al-kitāb bi-ʻawn Allāh al-malik al-wahhāb fī baldat Arzanjān fī Madrasat Muʼmin yad [bi-yad] ʻabd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf al-mudhnib al-muḥtāj ilá raḥmat Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān fī shahr Jumādá al-Ākhir fī yawm al-Sabt sanat tisʻ wa-tisʻīn wa-alf."

Translation of the colophon: "The book is concluded by the help of God, the benevolant king, in the city of Arzanjān, at the School of Muʼmin, by Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān, the feeble and sinful servant who is in need of the mercy of God the most high, on Saturday, in the month of Jumādá al-Ākhir, 1099."

record.title: [Psalter and prayers].
record.note: Bound in plain wooden boards; four chain stitches, in leather case consisting of two parts, with carrying strap. Ff. 3r-130r: Psalter and Praises of Mary. Contains depictions of David and Gabriel(?). Some small holes in ms. Some marginal prayers. Some purple ink and pencil marginalia. Ethiopic writing and grafitti in the flyleaves. Includes printed page of Pss 3 and 4. Includes 1930 letters (copies) from Richard Gottheil of Columbia University regarding the ms.

Ff. 1r-1v (written upside down): Concluding prayer to be recited after the Praises of Mary, including appeals to Mary to intercede for members of the family of the owner of the book, Qaṣalā Giyoregis, in an untrained hand. Otherwise in the hand of Takela Giyoregis in red and black with the exception of ownership notes and pen trials. In Geʼez.
F. 130v: Colophon begins with a condemnation on anyone who steals or erases anything in the book. The book was written by Takela Giyoregis in 1917 EC, Tahsas 1.
F. 132v: Pen trials, based on the opening prayer of the Psalter.

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Shāfiyat Ibn al-Ḥājib : manuscript / Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādhī.
record.note: Title from reference sources, the printed version and folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah. Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh ʻalá tawālī niʻamih wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlih Muḥammad wa-ʻitratih al-maʻṣūmīn fa-qad ʻazamtu ʻalá an ashraḥa Muqaddimat Ibn al-Ḥājib fī al-taṣrīf wa-al-khaṭṭ wa-absiṭa al-kalām fī sharḥihā ka-mā fī sharḥ ukhtihā baʻḍ al-basṭ fa-inna al-shurrāḥ qad iqtaṣarū ʻalá sharḥ muqaddimat al-iʻrāb wa-hādhā maʻa qurb al-taṣrīf min al-iʻrāb fī masās al-ḥājah wa-maʻa kawnihimā min jins wāḥid baʻīd min al-ṣawāb ..."
Secundo folio: faʻīl wa-fuʻayʻil wa-fuʻayʻīl.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 17.5 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In buckram binding with red leather on spine and flap (in 22 numbered quires).
In fair naskh script, in black ink on white paper with the phrases of the "Shāfiyah" in purple; some notes and corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Shāfiyah fī al-taṣrīf li-Abī ʻAmr ʻUthmān ibn ʻUmar al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn al-Ḥājib al-Naḥwī al-Mālikī al-mutawaffá sanat 646 sitt wa-arbaʻīn wa-sittimiʼah wa-hiya muqaddimah mashhūrah fī hādhā al-fann ka-muqaddimat al-Kāfiyah fī al-naḥw wa-la-hu ʻalayhā sharḥ. Wa-qad iʻtaná bi-shaʼnihā jamāʻah min al-shurrāḥ ajalluhum al-Shaykh Raḍī al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥasan al-Astarābādī. Wa-mā atá bi-hi sharḥ jāmiʻ awwaluhu 'Ammā baʻda ḥamd Allāh taʻālá ʻalá tawālī niʻamih' ilá ākhirihi, kadhā fī Kashf al-Ẓunūn bi-al-tamām wa-al-kamāl wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá kull ḥāl."

On folio 1a an endowment statement: "Waqafa wa-aḥbasa hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad al-Bahī ibn al-Shaykh Muṣṭafá al-Ḥuwayḥī thumma al-Ṭandatānī ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-jaʻala al-naẓar li-nafsihi thumma li-man yaṣluḥu min awlādihi waqfan ṣaḥīḥan sharʻīyan lā yubāʻu wa-lā yurhanu wa-lā yubaddalu, fa-man baddalahu baʻdamā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Taḥrīran fī 3 Rajab sanat 1294 [14 July, 1877]."

Colophon: "al-Ḥamdu lillāh mulhim al-ṣawāb wa-al-sadād al-muwaffiq li-man arāda al-wuṣūl ilá al-murād wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá al-Nabī al-ʻAdnān wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi al-fāyizīn min Allāh bi-al-jinān. Wa-baʻd fa-yaqūlu al-rājī ʻafwa Rabbihi al-ʻālim Muḥammad ʻAlī al-mulaqqab bi-Abī Sālim: Tamma bi-ḥamd Allāh ṣāḥib al-niʻam al-kāfiyah naskhī sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah Raḍī al-Dīn ʻalá al-Shāfiyah fa-jāʼa bi-ḥamd Allāh muḥarraran muwaḍḍaḥan wa-munaqqaḥan muhadhdhaban muṣaḥḥaḥan wa-kāna dhālika al-tamām wa-al-ḥuṣūl wa-al-khitām muwāfiqan li-thamāniyah wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalat min shahr Jumād al-Awwal alladhī huwa min shuhūr iḥdá wa-tisʻīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min Hijrat man khalaqahu Allāh ʻalá akmal waṣf ṣallá Allāh ʻlayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-kull nāsij ʻalá minwālih mā tawālá al-jadīdān wa-ṭalaʻa al-Zibriqān. Āmīn, bi-jāh al-Amīn. M."

Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God who inspires what is true and correct and grants success to whoever endeavors to reach his goal. May prayer and peace be upon the ʻAdnanite Prophet, his family and his companions to whom God granted Paradise. Thereafter, Muḥammad ʻAlī, nicknamed Abū Sālim, who hopes for the forgiveness from his All Knowing Lord, says: Concluded is -- by the praise of God the bestower of the abundant graces -- the copying of the commentary of the learned scholar Raḍī al-Dīn on al-Shāfiyah. It was edited, explained, revised, elucidated and corrected. This was accomplished on the 28th of Jumād al-Awwal, of the year 1291 of the Hijrah of the One whom God created with perfect character, may God pray upon him and upon his family and those who follow him, as long as night and day alternate and the Moon shines, by the intercession of the the Faithful One. Amen."

record.title: 880-01 Image of Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Jesus Christ = Malekeʼe Māryām [ʼenā] malekʼa ʼIyasus.
record.note: In fair hand, in red and black.
On f. 11v, the scribe is mentioned, Gabera ʼAb.
Drawings of birds (ff. 1rv) and harags (f. 22r), in pencil. Contains decorative images of crosses...A large hole in f. 6 is stitched together.

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Jurjānī ʻalá Kashshāf al-Zamakhsharī : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla Jār Allāh al-ʻAllāmah, aḥsana Allāh ikrāmah fī dār al-maqāmah: al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala al-Qurʼān kalāman munaẓẓaman. Dalla bi-lāmay al-jins wa-al-mulk ʻalá ikhtiṣāṣ al-ḥamd bi-hi taʻālá, thumma waṣafahu bi-inzāl al-Qurʼān wa-tanzīlih wa-mā ardafahumā bi-hi riʻāyatan li-barāʻat al-istihlāl ..."
Secundo folio: yutaṣawwaru inzāl al-Qurʼān.
16 x 23 cm; written surface: 12 x 20.5 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: Modern binding.
In good naskh script, in black ink (with fountain pen), on white paper with the phrases of "al-Kashshāf" preceded by the phrase "qawluhu" (his saying) in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "al-ʻAllāmah al-Sayyid. Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Sharīf ʻalá al-Kashshāf lil-ʻAllāmah al-Zamakhsharī, raḥmahumā Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn." "Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid ʻalá al-Kashshāf." "Ḥāshiyat al-Sharīf ʻalá al-Kashshāf, nimrah 109."
On folio 1a Ownership statement: "Min niʻam Allāh taʻālá ʻalá mālikihi al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilayhi ʻazza shaʼnuhu Ibrāhīm al-Samanūdī al-Manṣūrī ʻafā Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu bi-mannih."
On spine: "Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid ʻalá al-Kashshāf." "Tafsīr. Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid al-Sharīf ʻalá al-Kashshāf." "Nūr al-Dīn Bik Muṣṭafá."

Colophon: "Intahá mā wujida min Ḥāshiyat al-Sharīf raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá ʻalá al-Kashshāf wa-lillāh al-mashīʼah wa-al-minnah wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad shams falak al-Sunnah wa-ʻalá ālihi nujūm al-dujunnah."

Translation of the colophon: "Concluded is what was found of the gloss of al-Sharīf, may God have mercy upon him, on al-Kashshāf. To God belongs the will and gratitude. Prayer and peace be upon our Master Muḥammad, the sun of the orbit of the Sunnah, and upon his family the [shining] stars in the darkness."

record.title: 880-02 al-Nafḥah al-miskīyah wa-al-tuḥfah al-Makkīyah : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Innahu min Sulaymān wa-innahu bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi al-iʻānah wa-al-tawfīq wa-huwa ḥasbī wa-niʻma al-wakīl. ʻIlm al-ʻarūḍ, ʻilm al-maʻānī, ʻilm al-badīʻ wa-jamīʻ dhālika kulluhu ʻilm al-ʻArabīyah ..."
Secundo folio: ʻalá namaṭ al-ʻunwān fī majmūʻih.
15.5 x 21 cm; written surface: 13.5 x 18 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair naskh script, in black and red ink on white paper with headings and markings in red; text within red frame.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Nafḥah al-miskīyah wa-al-tuḥfah al-Makkīyah taʼlīf al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah Shaykh al-Islām wa-al-Muslimīn faṣīḥ ʻaṣrih wa-farīd dahrih al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī nafaʻanā Allāh taʻālá bi-barakātih wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-al-Muslimīn min ṣāliḥ daʻawātih fī al-dīn wa-al-dunyā."

Colophon: "... wa-dhālika fī shahr Allāh Rajab, fī yawm al-Arbiʻāʼ al-thānī wa-al-ʻishrīn minhu sanat tisʻ wa-sittīn wa-thamānimiʼah. Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh taʻālá wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-kafá wa-salāmun ʻalá ʻibādihi alldhīna iṣṭafá wa-ṣallá Allāh [ʻalá] Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-muṣṭafá."

Translation of the colophon: "It is concluded by the praise of God and his abundant benevolence, on Wednesday, 22 of God's month Rajab, 869 [29 March, 1465]. Praise be to God alone and that is sufficient. Peace be on His servants whom He had chosen. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the chosen prophet."

record.title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala al-Jannah manzilan li-ʻibādih al-muʼminīn wa-khaṣṣahum fīhā bi-mazīd al-iḥsān wa-ashhadu an lā ilāha illā Allāh waḥdahu lā sharīka lah shahādata man qālahā khāliṣan mukhliṣan min qalbihi dakhala al-Jannah wa-muttiʻa fīhā bi-al-ḥūr wa-al-wildān wa-ashhadu anna Sayyidinā Muḥammad ʻabudhu wa-rasūluhu awwal man yadkhul al-Jannah wa-yaftaḥu la-hu Riḍwān ..."
Secundo folio: al-khāmis fī anhār al-Jannah.
16.5 x 23.5 cm; written surface: 11 x 18 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink (with fountain pen), on white paper; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi risālah tusammá Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ lil-Shaykh Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Tammat hādhihi al-risālah yawm al-Jumʻah al-mubārakah khamsah fī shahr Jumād al-Awwal sanat alf wa-miʼatayn thamāniyah wa-sabʻīn min al-Hijr [al-Hijrah] al-Nabwah [al-Nabawīyah] ʻalá yad kātibihā al-faqīr Muḥammad al-Asyūṭī al-Mālikī ghafara Allāh la-hu waliday [wa-li-wālidayhi] wa-mashāyikhihi wa-al-Muslimīn wa-asʼalu Allāh an yanfaʻa bi-hā kamā nafaʻa bi-uṣūlihā wa-an yajʻalahā khāliṣatan li-wajhihi al-karīm wa-sababan lil-fawz bi-ruʼyatihi fī janāt al-naʻīm. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This treatise ended on blessed Friday, 5 Jumād al-Awwal, 1278 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [8 November, 1861] by its poor copyist, Muḥammad al-Asyūṭī al-Mālikī. May God forgive him and his parents, his teachers and all Muslims. I beseech God to make it beneficial as He made beneficial its origins; that God may be please with me and a reason to enable me to see Him in the Paradise of Bliss. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad and on his family and all his companions. Amen."

record.title: In memoriam: Julius M. Keeler : manuscript.
record.note: Title from cover.

record.title: [Psalter, image of Michael, Asmat prayer against a snake, and prayer of faith.].
record.note: In fair hand, in red and black.

Ff. 1r-129v written in one column, ff. 130r-145r written in two columns. 22 lines. Some tears and holes in ms repaired by stitching. Some holes are written around, demonstrating that the parchment had gaps before use for writing. Sparse marginalia. Some wax stains.

record.title: [Catholic epistles].
record.note: In fair hand, in red and black. Two columns, 22-23 lines. Some graffiti in the flyleaves.
Four chain stitches, bound in limp leather covers.
Ff. 23v-24r. Pen trials. Blank: ff.1rv, 2rv, 24v.

record.title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
record.note: Title of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh from folio 1a.
Title of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah from folio 8a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻaẓīm wa-ḥasbunā Allāh wa-niʻma al-wakīl wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá wa-ālih [ālihi] wa-sallam. Saʼalta ayyuhā al-murīd al-mustarshid ʻan kunh mā lā budda laka minhu fa-ajabtuka fī hādhihi al-awrāq ʻalá mā saʼalta wa-Allāh walī al-tawfīq ..."
Secundo folio of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: al-ān ʻalá mā ʻalayhi kān.

Incipit of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī nazzala ahla al-Ḥadīth aʻlā [aʻlá] manāzil al-tashrīf wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī shahidat al-āyāt al-Qurʼānīyah wa-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah bi-annahu al-sayyid al-ʻafīf ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd al-ḍaʻīf al-rājī rabbahu al-raʼūf al-laṭīf Muḥammad ʻAbd al-Raʼūf: Hādhā kitāb awradtu fīhi bi-mā lam usbaq min al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah al-wāridah ʻan khayr al-barīyah ... wa-sammaytuhu al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah ..."
Secundo folio of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: Ibn Ādam akhluquka.
Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: 16 x 23 cm; written surface: 12 x 18.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: 16 x 23.5 cm; written surface 9 x 16 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding; al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah in 4 numbered quires.
In good ruqʻah and naskh scripts, in black ink, on white paper; some phrases and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh li-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Akbar Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn ʻArabī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ʻannā bi-hi. Āmīn. M."
On folio 8a: "al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah lil-ʻAllāmah al-Munāwī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. M."

On the lower left margin of folio 48a: "Iʻlam anna fī baʻḍ tilka al-Aḥādīth tawaqqufan min aṣl al-nuskhah al-manqūl minhā wa-kadhā aṣluhā wa-aṣluhā fa-ifham wa-ḥarrir wa-Allāh yatawallá hudāk. Āmīn."
Colophon of Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: "Intahá wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh wa-ḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh: "It is concluded. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. Amen. It is finished."

Colophon of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-sharīfah fī waqt al-ʻaṣr min yawm al-Aḥad al-mubārak al-muwāfiq li-iḥdá wa-ʻishrīn yawman khalat min shahr Jumād al-Awwal sanat 1286, sittah wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man la-hu al-ʻizz wa-al-sharaf. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥabihi wa-sallam."

Translation of the colophon of al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah: "The copying of this noble copy ended in the afternoon of blessed Sunday, 21 Jumād al-Awwal , 1286 [29 August, 1869] of the Hijrah of the glorious and honorable [Prophet]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace."

record.title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
record.note: Title from folio 1b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūl afqar al-ʻibād wa-aḥwajuhum ilá Allāh al-ʻalī al-qadr wa-al-shaʼn al-rājī minhu tabāraka wa-taʻālá al-raḥmah wa-al-ghufrān ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī. Hādhihi risālah fī uṣūl al-dīn jamaʻtuhā li-ṣighār al-banāt wa-al-banīn wa-sammaytuhā al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān, jaʻalahā Allāh khāliṣah li-wajhihi al-karīm ..."
Secundo folio: wa-anna Sayyidanā Muḥammad Rasūl Allāh.
12.5 x 18 cm; written surface: 7 x 12 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān li-ʻIzz al-Dīn Bik ʻAlī Maʼmūr Mālīyat Dunqulah ḥafiẓahu [Allāh] wa-aʻānahu wa-fataḥa ʻalayh. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Tamm."

On folio 9b: 1. A poem in praise of the treatise by "Ḥaḍrat al-ʻĀlim al-shahīr Mawlānā al-Shaykh ʻAlī Ḥusayn al-Bulāqī [probably, al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn al-Masraʻī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Būlāqī who was alive 1307/1890]." 2. A poem by al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Majīd al-Ghubāshī al-Azʹharī (could not be identified) praising the treatise and dating it in alphabetical reckoning (ḥsāb al-jummal): Halimmū ilayhā wa-iqraʼūhā wa-arrikhū // Zahat bi-bahāʼ al-ṭabʻi tilka al-Farāʼidu. 324."
On folio 10a: A short invocation in a different hand.

Colophon: "Katab hādhihi al-risālah al-faqīr al-ḥaqīr al-rājī ʻafwa rabbihi al-qadīr Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Qūṣī Yūsuf Ḥasan Nawfal al-Ḥajjājī. Wa-kāna tamāmuhā yawm al-Khamīs ithnayn wa-ʻishrīn al-Ḥijjah sanat alf wa-thalāthmiʼah wa-thalāthat ʻashar. Ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This treatise was copied by the poor and despised, who hopes for the forgiveness of his Mighty Lord, Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ʻAbd al-Ḥaqq al-Qūṣī Yūsuf Ḥasan Nawfal al-Ḥajjājī, on Thursday 22 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1313 [4 June, 1896]. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them abundant peace. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Rabbi yassir wa-tammim bi-al-khayr. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī shahidat li-waḥdānīyatihi al-āyāt al-bayyinah fī al-arḍ wa-al-samāwāt, wa-qāmat ʻalá rubūbīyatihi al-dalālāt, wa-dallat ʻalá ʻaẓamatihi ʻināyatuhu bi-al-aḥyāʼ wa-al-amwāt ... wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu ... Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī mawlidan al-Anṣārī nasaban ... fa-sharaʻtu fī dhālika mustaʻīnan bi-al-Malik al-qadīr yawm al-Sabt, rābiʻ Dhī al-Ḥijjah, sanat 1231, wa-sammaytuhu Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-muhadhdhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab ..."
Secundo folio: yawm al-Thulāthāʼ salkh Rajab.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 19 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In red leather binding with geometrical designs and flap (in 67 quires, quire 1 to 54 are numbered).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white aging paper, headings, keywords and markings in red; some corrections and notes on the margins; catchwords.
On folio 1a an endowment statement in the name of Aḥmad Muḥammad al-Sinjārī.
On folio 1a (in pencil): "Sharḥ al-Sindī ʻalá Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī."

Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna farāghī min taswīd hādhā al-mujallad al-awwal min Sharḥ Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fī yawm al-Sabt sābiʻ wa-ʻishrīn min Dhī al-Qaʻdah sanat 1234 bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah qubayla al-ʻaṣr. Jaʻalahu Allāh min al-aʻmāl al-maqbūlah wa-waffaqanī li-itmām sharḥihi fī aqrab al-awqāt. Kutiba bi-qalam muʼallifihi Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Anṣārī al-Sindī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-aslāfihi wa-mashāyikhihi wa-muḥibbīhi wa-jamīʻ aqāribih bi-faḍlihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Wa-ghafara li-kātibihi wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man ṭālaʻahu wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

Translation of the author's colophon: "The writing of the first volume of Sharḥ Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, May God have mercy upon him, was finished on Saturday, 27 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1234 in Mecca, before the afternoon, May God render it an acceptable work and may He grant me the ability to complete the commentary as soon as possible. Written by its author Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Anṣārī al-Sindī, May God, the Most High, forgive him, his ancestors, his teachers, his beloved ones and all Muslims, by his grace and generosity. Amen. May God also forgive its copyist, his parents, those who read it and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and grant them abundant peace."

record.title: 880-03 al-Adhkār al-Nawawīyah, aw, Ḥilyat al-abrār wa-shiʻār al-akhyār fī talkhīṣ al-daʻawāt wa-al-adhkār al-mustaḥabbah fī al-layl wa-al-nahār : manuscript / Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions (title page damaged).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: Most of the incipit page is damaged; the bracketed phrases are taken from the printed version: "Bi-ism [Allāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm]. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-wāḥid al-qahh[ār, al-ʻazīz al-ghaffār, muqaddir al-aqdār, muṣarrif al-umūr, mukawwir al-layl ʻalá] al-nahār tabṣiratan li-ulī al-qu[lūb wa-al-abṣār, alladhī ayqaẓa min khalqihi man iṣṭafāhu] fa-adkhalahu fī jumlat al-akhyār [wa-waffaqa man ijtabāhu min ʻabīdihi fa-jaʻalahu min al-muqarrabīn al-abrār], wa-baṣṣara man aḥabbahu fa-zahhadahum fī h[dhihi al-dār fa-ijtahadū fī marḍātihi wa-al-taʼahhub li-dār al-qarār] wa-ijtināb mā yuskhiṭuhu wa-al-ḥadhar min ..."
Secundo folio: The beginning of the second folio is damaged.
24.5 x 17.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18.5 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding with flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white aging paper, headings in red; some corrections on the margins; most pages are damaged with considerable loss of text; no catchwords.
Colophon: The last page is damaged; text ends with: "... aw ghalaṭ, wa-huwa mukhālif lil-kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-naṣṣ Imāmunā [al-Shāfiʻī] ..."

record.title: 880-02 Sharḥ Ḥizb al-Nawawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Yā man aḥzābuhu lam tazal muʼayyadah, ʻalá al-aʻdāʼ manṣūrah, wa-aḥbābuhu lam tazal aʻlāmuhum bi-dhikrihi manshūrahk, fī ṣūrah aʻẓim bi-hā min ṣūrah. Naḥmaduka ʻalá ālāʼika al-ʻāmmah madadta bi-hā fa-lam takun maqṣūrah ..."
Secundo folio: ḥizbuhu min al-Qurʼān.
15.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 17 cm; 25 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard binding.

In naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper, headings and markings and the phrases of Ḥizb al-Nawawī in red; some corrections on the margins; some wormholes; text within double red frame; catchwords.

At folio 1a: Sharḥ Ḥizb al-Imām al-Zāhid al-wariʻ al-ḍābiṭ al-muḥaqqiq Muḥyī al-Dīn Abī Zalarīyā Yaḥyá al-Quṭb al-Nawawī lil-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ʻumdah al-fahhāmah Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī thumma al-Madanī laṭafa Allāh taʻālá bi-nā wa-bihi."

Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu ʻabd Allāh taʻālá al-faqīr ilá ʻafwihi wa-maghfiratih Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī thumma al-Madanī kāna Allāh la-hu wa-jaʻalahu mimman lil-wilāyah ahlah: Wāfaqa al-farāgh minhu ḍaḥwat al-Ithnayn al-tāsiʻ min Ṣafar al-Khayr ʻām ithnayn wa-khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf bi-manzilī bi-al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah taḥta al-Manārah al-Sulaymānīyah min al-Masjid al-Sharīf ṣallá Allāh ʻalá musharrifihi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

Translation of the colophon: "Its author, the servant of God who is in need of His pardon and forgiveness, Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī al-Madanī, May God be on his side and make him worthy of the Sufi status (wilāyah) said: The book was finished on Monday morning, the ninth of Ṣafar, the year 1152 at my home in al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah under the Sulaymānīyah Minaret of al-Masjid al-Sharīf, May God pray on Him who had honored it by His presence, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God alone."

record.title: Selections from the Qurʼan and invocations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish : manuscript.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Starts with part of verse 11 of Sūrat Yāsīn (folio 3a): "... al-dhikr wa-khashiya al-Raḥmān bi-al-ghayb fa-bashshirhu bi-maghfiratin wa-ajrin karīm. Innā naḥnu nuḥyī al-mawtá wa-naktubu mā qaddamū wa-āthārahum wa-kulla shayʼin aḥṣaynāhu fī imāmin mubīn ..."
Secundo folio: wa-mā kunnā munzilīn
10.5 x 16 cm; written surface: 8 x 12.5 cm; 11 lines per page.
Binding: In brown leather binding with flap; central medallions on front and back covers and on flap.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On folios 1b-2a: An invocation in Ottoman Turkish.
Folio 22 is torn.
On folios 23a-32a: Invocations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish.
Ends with Sūrat al-Fātiḥah.

record.title: 880-02 al-Mawlid al-Nabawī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Raḥīm ibn Aḥmad al-Buraʻī.
record.note: Title from the printed versions.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī jaʻala falaka al-qudrah ʻalá dawr al-ḥikmah fī aqṭār quṭb al-mijarrah mustadīran, wa-jaʻala qamar al-ʻizzah ʻalá ṣafāʼ ṣadaf qaʻr al-baḥr fī madārij al-kawākib mustanīran, wa-fataqa ʻalá ṣafaḥāt al-ufuq bi-yad al-aqdār min ṭīb al-kalām ʻanbaran wa-ʻabīran ..."
Secundo folio: āsan wa-yāsamīnan wa-nisrīnan.
13 x 20 cm; written surface: 8 x 13.5 cm; 13 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with leather spine.
In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, headings and markings in red; text within red frame; catchwords.
At the head of folio 1b: A decorative geometrical design in black and red.
At the very end of the text in a different hand: "Sulaymān ibn al-Ḥājj Khiḍr", probably an owner.

Ends with: "Rabbanā taqabbal minnā innaka anta al-samīʻ al-ʻalīm wa-tub ʻalaynā innaka anta al-tawwāb al-raḥīm. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻizzah ʻammā yaṣifūn wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

record.title: 880-03 Insān al-ʻuyūn fī sīrat al-amīn al-maʼmūn : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Ibrāhīm al-Ḥalabī.
record.note: Title from reference sources.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. Bāb dhikr maghāzīhi ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam. Dhukira anna maghāziyahu, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, ay, wa-hiya allatī ghazā fīhā bi-nafsihi kānat sabʻan wa-ʻishrīn, ay, wa-hiya Ghazwat Buwāṭ thumma Ghazwat al-ʻAshīrah thumma Ghazwat Ṣafwān ..."
Secundo folio: wa-al-Ṭāʼif thumma Ghazwat Tabūk.
16.5 x 23 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 16 cm; 23 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with brown leather on spine and flap (in 20 quires; the first 13 quires are numbered)
In good medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, headings and keywords in red; catchwords.
On the lower edge of the leaves: "Min al-Sīrah al-Ḥalabīyah."

Ends with: "Wa-fī hādhihi al-sanah al-khāmisah khusifa al-qamar fa-ṣallá Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalyahi wa-sallam, bi-aṣḥābihi ṣalāt al-khusūf ḥattá injalá al-qamar wa-ṣārat al-Yahūd taḍribu bi-al-ṭisās wa-yaqūlūn: 'Saḥara al-qamar'. Tammat hādhihi al-ghazwah wa-min baʻdihā Ghazwat al-Khandaq."

record.title: 880-02 Sulāfat al-mudām al-tibrīyah fī takmīl sharḥ ḥizb al-quṭb Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Bakrī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad Murtaḍá al-Zabīdī.
record.note: Title from title page (folio 1a)
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi thiqatī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī ajrá maknūn aḥadīyatihi fī sufun wāḥidīyatihi wa-ahabb ʻalayhā riyāḥ raḥmānīyatihi fa-istawá ʻalá Jūdī ṣamadānīyatihi fa-adār bi-dawarānihā al-aflāk ..."
Secundo folio: hum al-ghālibūn ammā baʻd.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 8.5 x 14.5 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.

In beautiful naskh script, in black ink, on white paper, with keywords in red; text within double red frame; some leaves glued together because of water damage with considerable loss of text; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Sulāfat al-mudām al-tibrīyah fī takmīl sharḥ ḥizb al-quṭb Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Bakrī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-asrārihi, tahdhīb al-faqīr ʻabd mawlāh Muḥammad Murtaḍá al-Ḥasanī, ʻufiya ʻanhu. Āmīn."
On leaf 1a an endowment statement: "Yā mawlāy. Yā wāḥid shaʼnih. Waqafa hādhā al-kitāb al-Sayyid Muḥammad Abū al-Anwār al-Sādāt. 1193."
Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly; last five lines illegible because of water damage.

record.title: 880-02 al-Masāʼil al-muftá bi-hā ʻalá al-qadīm : manuscript / Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawawī.
record.note: Title from title page.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Qāla, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá: Faṣl. Kull masʼalah fīhā qawlān lil-Shāfiʻī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu, qadīm wa-jadīd, fa-al-jadīd huwa al-ṣaḥīḥ wa-ʻlayhi al-ʻamal li-anna al-qadīm marjūʻ ʻanh. Wa-istathná jamāʻah min aṣḥābinā naḥwa ʻishrīn masʼalah aw akthar ..."
Secundo folio: al-shafaq wa-masʼalat al-munfarid.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10 x 15.5 cm; 21 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In good naskh script, in black ink on white paper with some keywords in red; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Masāʼil al-muftá bi-hā ʻalá al-qadīm taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Imām wa-al-baḥr al-humām al-ʻumdah al-ʻallāmah Muḥyī al-Dīn al-Nawawī. Raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi. Āmīn."
Colophon: "Wa-billāh al-iʻānah wa-al-tawfīq. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Āmīn. Tamm."
Translation of colophon: "From God comes help and success. Praise be to God alone. May God pray on the One who no prophet comes after him. Amen. Concluded."

record.title: [Miracles of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, and image of Galawedéwos (Claudius)].
record.note: Bound in plain wooden boards; four chain stitches, in leather slip-case, with loops for missing carrying strap. Some holes and tears in parchment stitched back together. Sparse marginalia.

Notes: F. i r(ecto): “Miracles of the Virgin” written in a Western hand; F. 12r and passim mention the owner, ገብራ ገላወዴዎስ; Blank: ff. i v(erso)–ii v(erso), the two folios (recto and verso) between numbered folios 52 and 53, 91r–92v.
Two columns (ff. 1r–86v); One column (ff. 87r–90v). 14 lines.

record.title: [Psalter, Song of Songs, and hymn].
record.note: Wood covers, four chain stitches, leather Oriental binding, fine cloth visible between the paste downs. German typescript of Holmes' notes glued to the flyleaf -- Holmes mentions that the MS contains a Psalter, Song of Songs, and a praise of Mary, and hypothesizes regarding the purpose of the outer calf-skin capsule. Sparse marginalia and scribal corrections. Some holes and tears in MS are stitched back together. Minor worming on the back cover.
One column (ff. 1r–123v; two columns (ff. 129r–145v). 24 lines.

F. 1r. Face plate pasted over the text: Yale University Library. Gideon Scull and Elizabeth Holmes Memorial. Gift of Edmund Wales Holmes, AB, MD. Class of 1872. 1920 [date of donation?]; F. 2 contains a report in German of the contents and date of the book, in which the writer makes a case for the 17th century. However, the Psalter is clearly written by a hand of the late-nineteenth or early-twentieth century; Blank: Ff. 2v–4v, 145r–148v; Word for God is rubricated throughout.

record.title: [Psalter, with Psalms of the Saint Mary, Blessed Virgin, with Biblical Canticles, Song of Songs, and Gate of Light].
record.note: Oriental leather binding over wooden boards; one column (ff. 1r–189v); two columns (ff. 190r–209r). 20 lines per page.
Contains an English translation of Psalm 151 in the flyleaf. Some tears and holes in MS stitched together. Some later scribal alterations.

F. ii v, note of provenance: "This Psalter was one of the books found in Magdala when that place was taken by Sir Robert Napier, afterwards Lord Napier of Magdala, in 1868. The collection had been formed by [King] Theodore with the intention of founding a large Library. These books were carried off by our people, and partly given to Abyssinian churches on the march back to Zayla [?], and a number were brought back to England for our own and for foreign libraries. When nearing Zoula on the return march, M. Munzinger, who had charge of the books, found that he had a few to spare, and among them was this Psalter, which he gave to me. -- William Simpson, 2nd April, 1881."; F. 1r: note in the upper margin: ዳዊት ዘ ቅዱስ መድኃኔ ዓለም (this is the statement that the Psalter belonged to the Great Library to be formed at Magdala by Theodore -- W. Simpson); Fine cloth is visible between the paste downs of the front and back cover; The Qalu counting employs the number 9, and does not include the strophes of the Virgin Mary; Blank: ff. iii r, 209v.

record.title: Commonplace book, [ca. 1786]
record.note: Author not identified.
Only rectos of leaves are numbered after page 20.
Entries are penned in sepia ink by a legible hand.
Bound in calf hide, tooled border decorations, spine title 'Placebook'.
Four fragments ([9] pages) with notes on British history, geography and astronomy, laid in.

record.title: Antoine Chambaud letterbook and accounts : manuscript.
record.note: Laid in: five additional undated accounts related to the Chambaud fabric business.
Laid in: autograph letter, signed "Villard," addressed to "Madame Chambaud," 1821 January 24.
Annotations in pencil on front pastedown.
Binding: original patterned paper boards.

record.title: Walter Hawkesworth account book : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Written on page 1 recto: "Disb.ts for the Year 1709 to Mic: 1710. 1709/10"; signatures "Lucy Hawkesworth" and "WHawkeworth"; and pen trials in different hands.
Binding: original reused parchment scrap, stitched: "In this are the Inventory of the Goods" written on inside back flap.

record.title: Physica particularis : manuscript.
record.note: Title from caption.
Autograph on second blank page: "Le Roux."
Red leather spine label, gilt: "Phisic. Part 1."
Binding: eighteenth-century full marbled calf with compartmented spine, gilt.

record.title: Wolfgang Pielnhuber commonplace book containing Latin aphorisms : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Ownership inscription of Wolfgang Pielnhuber, dated 1625 August 26, on page 5.
Signed annotation by Georg König on final page (page damaged).
Faded annotated leaf bound in at the end of the volume: "Alexander Velberis Augustanus...."
Binding: modern full calf in seventeenth-century style.

record.title: Rental book for unidentified properties in the Netherlands : manuscript.
record.note: Partially effaced title on front cover: "Rentboucxken van awerd Westerlos...."
Title devised by cataloger.
Binding: original limp parchment over cardboard, stitched; remains of ties.

record.title: Annotations in The tournament of Tottenham : manuscript.
record.note: Occasional marginal notes in both sections in different hands.
Laid in: two autograph letters to an unidentified recipient, signed by Markham John Thorpe, 1849 October 3 and 1849 October 4.
Laid in: autograph letter in the third person to "Mr. Howard" from Henry Sotheran & Co., including a pasted-on catalog description of this volume, 1893 June 5.
Binding: eighteenth-century full calf, repaired.

record.title: Roman writing tablet.
record.note: Possibly made from silver fir wood.
Housed in protective case, 25 cm x 20 cm.

record.title: Missal : use of Sarum.
record.note: Layout: double columns of 36 lines each.
Script: Gothic liturgical book script with Anglicana features.

Decoration: rubricated; numerous red and blue initials with contrasting penwork. 15 large illuminated and gilt initials with bar borders and foliate sprays; 1 large illuminated initial with full border in the style of the workshop of Herman Scheere.
Music: music with square notes on a 4-line red staff.
Binding: full goatskin over oak boards; sewn on 7 double thongs. Chemise binding with chemise portion now trimmed and folded over inside boards.
Byname: South Weald Missal.

record.title: Libellus.
record.note: The volume opens with a dedicatory preface addressed to Antoniotto Adorno, doge of Genoa.
Incipit: Libellus fr[atr]is thelofori p[re]sbiteri heremite....
Layout: single column, usually 37 lines.
Script: Italian semigothic.

Decoration: Rubricated with red penwork initials. Multiple illustrations on ff. 5,19r,19v,21r,22e,22v,24r,28v,31v and 32r, drawn in brown with ochre, red, blue and brown body colors and pale pink wash for flesh, depicting key events of the prophecy, including the battles with the various Anti-Christs, showing rulers, angels, demons, and the true and false popes.
Binding: 19th-century English full calf, heavily embossed with lattice pattern.

record.title: Two painted binding panels on wood : artwork.
record.note: Accompanied by a glazed shadow box for display.

record.title: Bible in shorthand : manuscript.
record.note: Title devised by cataloger.
Opening page contains 10 small ink illustrations and is dated 1672. The opening page to the New Testament is dated 1673.
Annotation in pencil on verso of front flyleaf: "From Sir Carew Vyvyan / Bart: / Trellowarren nr Helston / Cornwall / a.d. 1760 / Oriel Coll: Oxon."
Binding: contemporary full black morocco with gilt double fillet and corner ornamentation. Compartmented spine, gilt. Red leather spine label, gilt: "Holy Bible."

record.title: Daniel Pellizari notebook containing Latin exercises : manuscript.
record.note: Ownership inscription in red ink on front pastedown: "Daniel Pellizari."
Laid in: scrap of paper annotated "Daniel Pellizari. Sils. 1675."
Binding: bound in scrap of early parchment document, almost completely erased; remains of silk ties. Stamped in gilt on back cover with small shield containing picture of unidentified animal.

record.title: Repetitiones logicae : manuscript.
record.note: Title from spine.
Library stamp of Philippe Bragard on front pastedown; bookplate laid in.

Binding: contemporary blind-stamped and blind-ruled calf. Compartmented spine with the title "Repetitiones logicae" blindstamped in second compartment. Leather ties with fastening buckles, apparently restored.

record.title: Depences du roy en 1693 : manuscript.
record.note: First 28 pages have been removed; manuscript begins with page 29.
Internal title page on page 171: "Estat et menu general de la depence ordinaire bouche de la maison de Monseigneur le Dauphin annee 1693."
Title from spine.
Binding: contemporary full sheep; paneled spine, repaired, gilt. Title lettered on spine, gilt. Marbled endpapers.

record.title: [Book of Genesis in Tigrinya].
record.note: Translated by Debtera Matteos of Adwa.
In red and black, carefully layed out, one column, 19 lines with a running header giving title and chapter.
Leather binding with title on spine: "Liber Geneseo Tigrice."
The pages are carefully laid out. Each verse is given in the outer margin. Each chapter is introduced by the word “Chapter” and the number.

record.title: [Five Ethiopian scrolls of spiritual healing].
record.note: In fair hand, in red and black.

Scroll 1 contains a decorative headpiece and uses brown and black ink. Scroll 4 contains multiple decorative section dividers. Uses black, red, and blue ink. Scroll 5 contains drawings of angels and "evil eyes" comparable to scroll 4.
Scroll 1 = 481 x 61 mm. Scroll 2 = 549 x 73 mm. Scroll 3 = 1467 x 60 mm. Scroll 4 = 1495 x 98 mm. Scroll 5 = 1538 x 68 mm.

record.title: [Antiphonary for the whole year].
record.note: In red and black.
Wooden binding with twine spine. Cover is decorated with a cross. Half of the back cover is missing.
Four chain stitches; three columns; 29 to 32 lines per page.
F. 51r: Scribal note of completion: “Here ends the Deggua in the year of Mark (the Evangelist), on Ter 3, with great effort and problems . . . by the scribe Elyas;” Blank: Ff. 51v, 75r, 79rv.

record.title: [Homily of the suffering and death of our Lord and savior, Jesus Christ, the life giver, written by the three evangelists and virgins Bridget, Matilda, and Elizabeth].
record.note: Bound between wooden boards, two columns, 17 lines per page. Wood and red leather binding and spine with impressed decorations of frames and crosses.
F. 11r and passim (e.g., ff. 15r, 21v, 30v, 34r, and especially the concluding note on 103r) mention the owner, ወለተ ማርያም, and the scribe, ወልደ ሥላሴ.
Inside front cover has a crude drawing of faces; F. 1v has a crude drawing of a person.

record.title: 880-02 Rashf al-zulāl min al-siḥr al-ḥalāl : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from incipit (folio 1a).
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Hādhā Rashf al-zulāl min al-siḥr al-ḥalāl fī aḥad wa-ʻishrīn ʻāliman lammā tazawwaja kull wāḥid minhum waṣafa laylatahu mūriyan bi-alfāẓ fannihi min maqāmāt al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-ḥāfiẓ al-Shaykh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn."
Secundo folio: fa-lammā faragha min ʻiẓatihi.
16 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In red cardboard binding.
In clear naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; catchwords.
On folios 17b and 18a seals of "Ibrāhīm."

Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir al-maqāmāt. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābih dhawī al-murūwāt al-dhābbīn ʻan dīnihi bi-ḥadd al-murhafāt wa-sallama taslīman kathīran ilá yawmin tuḍāʻafu fīhi al-ḥasanāt. Balaghat muqābalatan bi-ḥasb al-ṭāqah. Sanat 1270."

Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of the "maqamahs". May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and companions, the virtuous ones, who protect his religion by the edge of the sharp swords, and grant them abundant peace, until that day in which good deeds will be rewarded multiple folds. It was collated to the best of ability in the year 1270."

record.title: Biographies of Muslim leaders : manuscript.
record.note: Title of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj" from folio 1a.
Title of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq" from folio 17a.
Title of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb" from folio 31a.
Title of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā" from folio 43a.
Title of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá" from folio 48a.
Title of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn" from folio 53a.
Title of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī" from folio 59a.
Title of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī" from folio 67a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ḥamdan li-man nawwara al-wujūd wa-maḥā ʻan muḥayyāh qatām al-aḥzān wa-qashaʻa ʻan samāʼ ṭalʻatihi ghawāsiq al-bawn bi-ishrāq shumūs al-isrá [al-Isrā] ..."

Incipit of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-bi-hi nastaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī aṭlaʻa fī samāʼ al-sharaf shams al-durrah al-Muḥammadīyah sāṭʻat al-ḍiyāʼ wa-al-anwār wa-asṭaʻa nūr al-kamāl zāhiran fī jabhat al-dhāt al-Aḥmadīyah musarbalatan bi-malābis al-jamāl wa-al-asrār ..."

Incipit of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Ayā man qarraba ilá ḥaḍrat mushāhadatihi man ikhtārahiu min ʻibādih wa-iṣṭafāh wa-ijtabā [wa-ijtabá] li-mukālamatihi man ṣaluḥa li-mujālasatihi wa-saqāhu min ṣafwat ʻuqār muwānasatihi mā ṣaffāh ..."

Incipit of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Ḥamdan li-man jaʻala maḥabbat ahl bayt Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, fāṭimatan ʻan irtiḍāʻ thady mā lā yarḍāh wa-nawwara layālī wujūdihim bi-miṣbāḥ al-Sayyid al-abarr ..."

Incipit of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-mannān bi-Muḥammad ibn ʻAdnān wa-al-shukr lillāh al-ḥannān bi-majmaʻ al-raʼfah wa-al-iḥsān wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām minhu ʻalá khayr al-kirām wa-ʻalá jamīʻ al-anbiyāʼ al-fikhām wa-ʻalá al-āl wa-al-aṣḥāb wa-al-atbāʻ ..."

Incipit of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Subḥāna man zayyana nuḥūr man shāʼ bi-mā shāʼ min jawāhir al-qabūl wa-al-iqbāl wa-adhāqahu min ḥumayyā ḥubbihi fa-intashá min ʻuqār dhālika al-zulāl ..."

Incipit of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh al-qādir alladhī arsala ʻalá ʻabdihi saḥāʼiba al-fatʹḥ wa-al-ʻirfān wa-jaʻalahu bāzan ashhab ilá awj al-maʻālī ṭāyir wa-quṭban nayyiran bayna kawākib al-akhdān ..."

Incipit of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī arsala Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam, bi-kāmil al-sharīʻah wa-khāliṣ al-dīn wa-ḥallá jīd risālatihi bi-bāhir al-khawāriq wa-ayyadahu bi-kumāt al-aṣḥāb al-muhtadīn ... Wa-baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-muftaqir ilá faḍl al-Karīm al-munjī Jaʻfar ibn Ḥasan ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm al-Barzanjī: Hādhihi nubdhah min aḥwāl al-quṭb al-Rabbānī wa-al-ghawth al-ṣamadānī ... Sayyidinā al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī ..."
Secundo folio of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": dūnihi Jibrīl wa-jamīʻ.
Secundo folio of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": durr majdihi bi-ḍiyāʼ.
Secundo folio of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": al-muʼminīn Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb.
Secundo folio of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": qāʼilahā ʻan waṣmat al-nifāq.
Secundo folio of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": qāla khayr nisāʼihā Maryam.
Secundo folio of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": bi-surūr jawāhir kuntu lak.
Secundo folio of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": lawāmiʻ al-anwār wa-aṣḥābihi.
Secundo folio of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": hādhihi nubdhah min aḥwāl.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: varies; lines per page vary.
Binding: In yellowish brown leather binding with flap; central medallions on front and back covers and flap.
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; some notes and corrections on the margins; some texts fully vocalized; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj min taʼlīf al-ḥaqīr Ṣiddīq al-Madanī ibn ʻUmar Khān tilmīdh al-Shaykh Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Sammān nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 17a: "Hādhihi Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-afāḍ ʻalaynā min hibāt fayḍihi wa-jadwāh, taʼlīf al-muftaqir ilá ʻafw Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn ʻabduhu Muḥammad Taqī al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh ʻUmar ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir Amīn al-Zarʻah al-Faqīh al-Ḥanafī al-Makkī, kāna Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh. Āmīn."

On folio 31a: "Hādhihi Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-arḍāh wa-jaʻala al-Jannah munqalabahu wa-mathwāh wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."
On folio 43a: "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā lil-marḥūm Mawlānā al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Jafrī, khādim al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn."

On folio 48a: "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá li-sibṭihā al-aḥrá wa-najlihā al-ajrá al-faqīr al-ghanī ʻAbd Allāh Mīrghanī, kāna Allāh la-hu wa-al-Muslimīn."
On folio 53a: "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn li-Mawlānā al-marḥūm Muḥammad al-Jafrī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."
On folio 59a: "Hādhihi Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu wa-amaddanā bi-madadihi. Āmīn."

On folio 60a, the geneaology of the Sufi Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī is given as: "al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qādir ibn Mūsá ibn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Yaḥyá al-Zāhid ibn Muḥammad ibn Dāwūd ibn Mūsá al-Jawn ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Maḥḍ ibn al-Ḥasan al-Muthanná ibn al-Ḥasan al-Sibṭ ibn Sayyidinā ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib wa-ibn al-Sayyidah Fāṭimah bint Rasūl Allāh."
Folios 65 and 66 are blank.
On folio 67a: "Hādhihi Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam."

Colophon of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": "Tammat Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj min taʼlīf al-Shaykh Ṣiddīq ibn ʻUmar Khān tilmīdh Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān, 22 shahr Rajab al-fard, sanat 1209 [12 February, 1795]. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj": "The copy of Mawāsim al-ibtihāj fī istimāʻ mukhtaṣar al-Miʻrāj of al-Shaykh Ṣiddīq ibn ʻUmar Khān, a student of Sayyidī al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Sammān was completed on 22 Rajab, 1209 [12 February, 1795]. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

Colophon of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": "Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻIzzah ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-Mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ālii wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "Durrat al-ʻiqd al-ʻaqīq wa-zahrat al-ghuṣn al-rashīq fī manāqib Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Sayyid al-Sanad Abī Bakr al-Ṣiddīq": "Glory be to God, the Lord of Glory. He is more sublime than what they describe. May peace be upon the Messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. Amen."

Colophon of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": "Subḥāna Rabbika Rabb al-ʻIzzah ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-Mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Qurrat aʻyun al-aḥbāb fī baʻḍ manāqib Abī Ḥafṣ Sayyidinā ʻUmar ibn al-Khaṭṭāb": "Glory be to God, the Lord of Glory. He is more sublime than what they describe. May peace be upon the Messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is concluded. It is concluded. It is concluded. It is concluded."
Colophon of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": "Tamma wa-kamula bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih."
Translation of the colophon of "al-Fatʹḥ wa-al-bushrá fī manāqib al-Zahrā": "It is concluded and completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence."

Colophon of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": "Wa-hādhā khatm al-Maqāṣid wa-al-Fātiḥah ʻalá al-Maqāṣid wa-ʻalá nīyat kull qāṣid. Wa-kamula bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Allāhum ighfir li-kātibihi wa-li-qārīhi wa-li-nāẓirihi. Āmīn."

Translation of the colophon of "al-Maqāṣid al-fukhrá fī baʻḍ manāqib al-Sayyidah Khadījah al-Kubrá": "This is the end of 'al-Maqāṣid'. May [Sūrat] al-Fātiḥah be on 'al-Maqāṣid' and on the intentions of all seekers. It is completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. I beseech God to forgive its author, its reader and those who look into it. Amen."
Colophon of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": "Tammat bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih yawm al-Jumʻah waqt al-ẓuhr. Āmīn. Āmīn. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "al-ʻIqd al-thamīn fī manāqib al-Sayyidah ʻĀʼishah Umm al-Muʼminīn": "It is completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence on Friday noon. Amen. Amen. It is completed."
Colophon of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": "Tamma wa-kamula bi-ʻawn Allāh wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Manāqib Sayyidī Abī Ṣāliḥ al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Qadir al-Jīlānī": "It is concluded and completed by the help of God and His abundant benevolence. It is concluded. It is concluded. It is concluded."

Colophon of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Tamm. Tamm. Tamm."

Translation of the colophon of "Nubdhah fī manāqib Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Qādir al-Jīlānī": "Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions. It is completed. It is concluded. It is concluded."

record.title: 880-02 al-Fatʹḥ al-mubīn bi-sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn : manuscript / Shihāb al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm wa-huwa ḥasbī. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī waffaqa ṭāʼifatan min ʻulamāʼ kull ʻaṣr lil-qiyām bi-aʻbāʼ al-Aḥādīth wa-al-sunan wa-mayyazahum ʻalá siwāhum bi-sulūkihim awḍaḥ al-maḥajjah wa-aqwam al-sunan ..."
Secundo folio: taʼassiyan bi-al-Kitāb al-majīd.
16 x 21.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 16 cm; 27 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard and red leather with flap; codex in marbled cardboard and red leather case with a cloth ribbon to pull it out.
In good naskh/ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings and markings in red; some corrections on the margins; catchwords.
Table of contents (folio 1a-1b).
On case: "Sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn li-Ibn Ḥajar."

On folio 1a: Two ownership statements: 1. "Fī nawbat al-faqīr al-Sayyid Muḥammad Ṣādiq al-Maydānī bi-thaman [price erased]." 2. "Fī maktabat al-faqīr ilá Allāh taʻālá Muḥammad Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Qūwatlī sanat 1267 fī 18 Shaʻbān al-mukarram al-muʻaẓẓam al-mufakhkham."

On folio 1a: Names of scholars and some death dates statements: al-Sayyid Taqī al-Dīn al-Ḥiṣnī (died 18 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1129), al-Shaykh ʻUthmān al-Shamʻah al-Shāfiʻī (died Tuesday, 19 Ṣafar, 1126), al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Kuzbarī (died 1264), al-Shaykh ʻAbd Allāh al-Kuzbarī (died 1265), al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Muslim ibn al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Kuzbarī (started teaching in 1265), al-Shaykh Abū al-Mawāhib al-Ḥanbalī (died Wednesday, 30 Shawwāl, 1126), al-Shaykh ʻUthmān ibn Ḥammūdah al-Shāfiʻī (died Friday, end of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1120, in Damascus), al-Shaykh Ḥāmid al-ʻAṭṭār (died 1264), al-Shaykh Salīm Afandī al-ʻAṭṭār (started teaching instead of al-Shaykh Ḥāmid al-ʻAṭṭār, probably his father). Written by Muḥammad Ḥasan ibn al-Sayyid Muḥammad al-Qūwatlī, 18 Shaʻbān, 67 [1267].

On folio 2a: "Kitāb al-Fatʹḥ al-mubīn Sharḥ al-Arbaʻīn lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻallāmah al-humām barakat al-Muslimīn Shihāb al-millah wa-al-dīn niʻmat Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi fī al-ʻālamīn Aḥmad Shihāb al-Dīn ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī al-Makkī raḥmahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

Colophon: "Wa-kāna al-farāgh min tanjīz hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ṣabīḥat yawm al-Sabt al-mubārak shābiʻ ʻashar min shahr Dhī al-Ḥijjah min shuhūr sanat tisʻah ʻashar wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā azká al-salām wa-al-taḥīyah ʻalá yad afqar al-wará wa-aḥwajihim ilá Allāh taʻālá ʻAbd al-Salām ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Dihnah, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on the morning of blessed Saturday, 17 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the year 1119 of the Hijrah of the Prophet, best peace and greetings be upon Him, by the poorest and the most needy to God the Most High, ʻAbd al-Salām ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn Manṣūr al-Dihnah, may God forgive him, his parents, and all Muslims. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

record.title: 880-02 al-Īḍāḥ fī al-nikāḥ wa-al-bāh : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
record.note: Title from folio 2b.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhā kitāb al-waṣīyah al-mashhūr al-musammá fī ʻilm al-nayk wa-yusammá al-Īḍāḥ fī al-nikāḥ wa-al-bāh fī al-rujūʻ [rujūʻ] al-shaykh ilá al-ṣibāh [ṣibāh] lil-Shaykh al-ajall Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, wa-dhālika mashhūr lammā fasiqū ahl miṣr allafa lahum hādhā al-kitāb ḥattá rajiʻū ʻan al-liwāṭ bi-barakat al-Shaykh, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá ..."
Secundo folio: al-makhāṣī ʻalá al-shfār.
16 x 22 cm; written surface: 10.5 x 16 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap.
In fair naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; with headings and markings in red; catchwords.
Table of contents (folios 1b-2a): "Hādhihi Fihrist hādhā al-kitāb al-musammá bi-al-Īḍāḥ."

On folio 1a: Kitāb al-bāh fī rujūʻ al-shaykh ilá al-ṣibāh [ṣibāh] taʼlīf al-ajall Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī nafaʻanī Allāh bi-ʻulūmih wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-yalīhi nukat wa-ḥikāyāt wa-qarʻah."
On front cover: "Fī al-Īḍāḥ lil-Suyūṭī."
Text: Folios 2b-46b.
On folios 47a-48a: various anecdotes, intrigues and jokes.
Colophon: "Intahá Kitāb al-Īḍāḥ lil-Suyūṭī."
Translation of the colophon: "The book of al-Īḍāḥ by al-Suyūṭī is concluded."

record.title: 880-02 ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī.
record.note: Title from folio 2a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm, wa-Allāh bi-kull shayʼ ʻalīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh alladhī anzala min al-samāʼ māʼan fa-aḥyā bi-hi al-arḍ, wa-akhraja thamarāt kull shayʼ bi-qudratih kamā yukhriju al-khalāʼiq yawm al-ʻarḍ, wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad alladhī bayyana la-nā al-mashrūʻ wa-ghayr al-mashrūʻ, wa-kammal bi-al-sunnah wa-alzama bi-al-farḍ ... Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu al-ʻabd ... al-madʻū bi-ʻAbd al-Ghanī ... lammā wajadtu kitāb al-filāḥah al-musammá bi-Jāmiʻ fawāʼid al-malāḥah lil-Shaykh ... Raḍī al-Dīn Abī al-Faḍl Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad al-Ghazzī al-ʻĀmirī al-Shāfiʻī ... kitāb jalīl al-miqdār ʻaẓīm al-nafʻ li-man yuʻānī zirāʻat al-arāḍī wa-tarbiyat al-ashjār wa-lākinnahu mimmā yaḥsunu fīhi al-ikhtiṣār fa-jamaʻtu al-himmah wa-lakhkhaṣtu ghālib mā fīhi min al-masāʼil al-muhimmah ... wa-sammaytuhu 'ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah' ..."
Secundo folio: ḥadhfuhu wa-al-muʼākhadhah wa-al-takrār.
14.5 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 9.5 x 15 cm; 19 lines per page.
Binding: In marbled cardboard with flap; codex in a case of marbled cardboard and red leather with a cloth ribbon to pull it out.
In beautiful medium naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; headings and markings in red; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah taʼlīf quṭb al-ʻārifīn Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī nafaʻanā Allāh wa-al-Muslimīn bi-madadihi. Āmīn. M."
On folio 1a: "Yā Kubaykij iḥfaẓ al-waraq."
On case: "al-Malāḥah bi-al-filāḥah li-Sayyidī ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī."

Author's colophon: "Wa-qad kamula mā sammaynāhu 'ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah'. Wa-katabahu jāmiʻuhu al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá mawlāhu al-khabīr ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Nābulusī khatama Allāh la-hu bi-al-ḥusná wa-amaddahu bi-al-madad al-asná, wa-dhālika fī ṣabīḥat nahār al-Ithnayn al-thāmin min shahr Shawwāl sanat sabʻ wa-ʻishrīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ḥāmidan Allāh taʻālá wa-muṣalliyan wa-musalliman ʻalá Rasūl Allāh wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-aṣḥābihi wa-atbāʻihi wa-aḥzābihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the author's colophon: "Concluded is what I titled 'ʻAlam al-malāḥah fī ʻilm al-filāḥah' [Banner of beauty in the science of agriculture]. It was written by its compiler the poor to his knowledgeable Lord ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn al-Nābulusī, may God grant him an agreeable end and a glorious strength, on Monday morning, 8 Shawwal, 1127 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [7 October, 1715]. I praise God the Most High and pray upon the Messenger of God and upon his family, his companions, his followers and all his parties. Amen."

Copyist's colophon: "Wa-qad waqaʻa al-farāgh min kitābat hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah ʻashīyat yawm al-Khamīs al-khāmis wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Dhī al-Qaʻdah, sanat wāḥid wa-thamānīn wa-miʼatayn wa-alf min hijrat man tammat fī jamīʻ aṣḥābihi al-ʻadālah wa-khutimat bi-hi ṣaḥāʼif al-nubūwah wa-al-risālah, ʻlayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi al-kirām wa-aṣḥābihi al-ʻiẓām mā yadūmu ilá qiyām al-sāʻah wa-sāʻat al-qiyām min al-ṣalāh al-lāʼiqah bi-hi wa-bi-him wa-al-salām, wa-dhālika ʻalá yad al-ʻabd al-faqīr ilá mawlāhu al-ghanī Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Azkiyah, adāma Allāh saḥāʼib riḍwānihi ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tammat wa-bi-al-khayr ʻammat. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

Translation of the copyist colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on Thursday evening, 25 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1281 [21 April, 1865] of the Hijrah of Him in whose companions justice was established, and in Him the sheets of the Prophecy and the Message were sealed (May the most decent prayer and peace be upon him and upon his honorable family and great companions, continuously, until the day of judgment and the hour of resurrection), by the servant of his Rich Lord, Aḥmad ibn Ibrāhīm ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Azkiyah, may God bestow upon him, and upon all Muslims the clouds of his satisfaction. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is completed and in widespread goodness concluded."

record.title: 880-02 Taqyīdāt ʻalá Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam ajmaʻīn. Qawluhu 'al-mutawaḥḥid' min al-tawaḥḥud, wa-min al-maʻlūm anna al-tawaḥḥud ʻalá wazn al-tafaʻʻul wa-ṣīghat al-tafaʻʻul taʼtī li-maʻān ..."
Secundo folio: in ikhtalafa al-muḍāf wa-al-muḍāf ilayh.
17.5 x 24.5 cm; written surface: 12.5 x 18.5 cm; 26 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (5 quires).

In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; some corrections on the margins; the phrases of 'Sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah' are preceded by the word 'Qawluhu' (His statement) in red; catchwords.
Text: Folios 1a-42a; folios 43-46 are blank.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Taqyīdāt ʻalá sharḥ al-ʻAllāmah al-Saʻd ʻalá matn al-ʻAqāʼid al-Nasafīyah jamaʻtuhā min taqrīr Shaykhinā al-Shaykh ʻAlī al-ʻAdawī al-Mālikī ḥāla al-dars. Tamm." "Jāmiʻuhā al-faqīr Muḥammad ʻArafah al-Dasūqī al-Mālikī al-Burhānī." "Yaqūlu kātibuhu: Hādhihi ṣūrat mā katabahu al-muʼallif wa-huwa al-ʻAllāmah al-Dasūqī ʻalá nuskhatihi allatī bi-khaṭṭihi wa-innamā athbattuhu ʻalá hādhihi al-nuskhah bi-hādhihi al-ʻibārah muḥāfaẓatan ʻalá ittibāʻ nuskhat al-muʼallif al-maktūb ʻalayhā dhālika, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi fī al-dārayn. Āmīn."

Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with: "wa-mithl dhālika yuqālu fī al-mashmūm, fa-al-rāʼiḥah al-qāʼimah bi-al-misk laysat hiya al-mashmūmah bal al-mashmūm rāʼiḥah ukhrá khalaqahā Allāh taʻālá qāʼimah bi-al-hawá [bi-al-hawāʼ] bi-sabab mujāwarat al-hawá [al-hawāʼ] lil-jurm dhī al-rāʼiḥah. Qawluhu 'wa-huwa qūwah mūdaʻah fī al-ʻuṣbatayn' ..."

record.title: 880-02 Mukhtaṣar Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Wahhāb ibn Aḥmad al-Shaʻrānī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Min mumidd al-kawn astamiddu al-ʻawn. al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn wa-ashhadu an lā ilāh illā Allāh al-malik al-ḥaqq al-mubīn, wa-ashhadu anna Muḥammadan ʻabduhu wa-rasūluhu sayyid al-awwalīn wa-al-ākharīn. Allāhumma ṣalli wa-sallam ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá sāyir al-anbiyāʼ wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihim wa-ṣaḥbihim ajmaʻīn. Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi qawāʻid ʻaẓīmah yaḥtāju ilayhā kull faqīh intakhabtuhā min kitāb al-Qawāʻid lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-Shaykh Badr al-Dīn al-Zarkashī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fa-man raʼá fī hādhihi al-qawāʻid khaṭaʼan aw taḥrīfan fa-li-yurājiʻ aṣlahu, fa-rubbamā yakūnu dhālika min sūʼ fahmī, wa-Allāh fī ʻawn al-ʻabd mā kāna al-ʻabd fī ʻawn akhīh, wa-rattabtuhā tibʻan li-aṣlihā ʻalá ḥurūf al-muʻjam tasʹhīlan lil-ṭālib ..."
Secundo folio: tanqīḥ al-adhhān al-rābiʻ al-mughālaṭāt.
15 x 20.5 cm; written surface: 11.5 x 15.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound.
In fair ruqʻah script, in black ink, on white paper; some wormholes on the margins without loss of text; catchwords.
On folio 1a: "Mukhtaṣar Kitāb Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī lil-Shaʻrāwī taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatihi. Āmīn." "Mukhtaṣar Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī."

On folio 1a ownership statements as follows: "Mālikuhu Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī." "Fī silk mulk Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī al-Qādirī al-Ḥawālikī ʻufiya ʻanh." "Mālikuhu kātibuhu Abū al-Isʻād ʻufiya ʻanh." "Thumma ṣāra fī nawbat al-faqīr Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Anṣārī al-Ḥusaynī al-Qādirī." "Ṣār fī mulk al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād ibn al-faqīr Shuʻayb al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī fī awākhir Dhī al-Qaʻdah al-Ḥarām sanat 1019 [13 February, 1611]." "al-Faqīr Aḥmad Abū al-Mawāhib ibn al-faqīr ʻAbd al-Jawwād Shuʻayb al-Shāfiʻī al-Anṣārī [...?]." "Thumma min baʻdihi ṣār fī silk mulk Abū al-Isʻād al-Shuʻaybī al-Qādirī [... ...?]." "Faded seal".

On folio 1a: "Wa-fīhi 'Kitāb al-Ishārah ilá sīrat Rasūl Allāh' ... muʼallifuhu al-Shaykh ʻAlāy al-Dīn al-Maṣlaṭāy ..." (Probably: "al-Ishārah ilá sīrat al-Muṣṭafá wa-tārīkh man baʻdahu min al-khulafāʼ" / by ʻAlāʼ al-Dīn Mughalṭāy ibn Qalīj, 1290 or 1291-1360 or 1361).
On folio 37b eight verses of poetry praising al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Wahhāb al-Shaʻrānī and giving the date of his death on Monday, 3 Jumād al-Awwal, 973 (6 December, 1665) by his son ʻAbd al-Raḥmān.

Colophon: "Wa-li-yakun dhālika ākhir al-qawāʻid al-muntakhabah min Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī, raḥimahu Allāh ... Wa-kāna farāghī min taʼlīfihi bi-tārīkh sābiʻ ʻashar Dhī al-Ḥijjah sanat 1011 [28 May, 1603] wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Yaqūlu kātibuhu al-faqīr Shuʻayb ibn Aḥmad: Katabtu hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah min nuskhah saqīmah jiddan, fa-taḥtāju hādhihi ilá al-muqābalah, wa-al-aṣl al-manqūl minhu yaḥtāj ilá dhālika min bāb awlá wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻalī al-ʻaẓī ..."

Translation of the colophon: "Let this be the end of the rules selected from Qawāʻid al-Zarkashī [The Rules of al-Zarkashī], may God have mercy upon him ... I finished writing it on 17 Dhū al-Ḥijjah, 1011 [28 May, 1603]. Praise be to God alone, and prayer be upon Him, who no prophet comes after Him. The copyist of the manuscript, the poor Shuʻayb ibn Aḥmad, says: I copied this blessed treatise from a very bad copy which needs to be collated, let alone the original source from which it was copied. There is no power nor might except in God the Sublime, the All Mighty ..."

record.title: 880-03 al-Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrīyah : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī al-Ḥarīrī.
record.note: Title from folio 1a.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. Qāla al-Shaykh al-ajall al-awḥad Abū Muḥammad al-Qāsim ibn ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUthmān al-Ḥarīrī al-Baṣrī, barrada Allāh maḍjaʻahu: Allāhumma innā naḥmaduka ʻalá mā ʻallamta min al-bayān wa-alhamta min al-tibyān kamā naḥmaduka ʻalá mā asbaghta min al-ʻaṭāʼ wa-asbalta min al-ghiṭāʼ wa-naʻūdhu bi-ka min shirrat al-lasn wa-fuḍūl al-hadhī ..."
Secundo folio: wa-lā nurhaqa bi-tabaʻatin wa-lā maʻtabah.
21 x 32 cm; written surface: 16.5 x 26.5 cm; 15 lines per page.
Binding: In red leather binding with flap; central and corner medallions on cover and flap (in 16 numbered quires).
In good naskh script, in black ink, on white paper; extensive commentaries and notes on the margins and interlinear; some wormholes; catchwords.

On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrīyah fī al-mawāʻiẓ wa-al-ādāb wa-al-aḍāḥīk wa-al-aḥājī. Ṣāḥibuhā wa-mālikuhā al-faqīr Baḥr Aḥmad, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. A.M.Y.N. [Āmīn])

On folio 1a: Two verses of poetry attributed to Jār Allāh al-Zamakhsharī (Zamakhsharī, Maḥmūd ibn ʻUmar, 1075-1144) praising al-Ḥarīrī and his Maqāmāt: "Uqsimu billāh wa-āyātihi // wa-mashʻar al-ḥajji wa-mīqātihi. Anna al-Ḥarīrīya ḥarrīyun bi-an // taktuba bi-al-tibri Maqāmātihi."
Colophon: "Qad tammat Maqāmāt al-Ḥarīrī bi-ʻawn Allāh al-ghanī."
Translation of the colophon: "The Maqāmāt of al-Ḥarīrī are concluded by the help of the rich God."

record.title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Amīr al-Kabīr ʻalá Sharḥ al-Samarqandīyah lil-Mullawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Kabīr.
record.note: Title supplied by cataloger.
Romanization supplied by cataloger.

Incipit: "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. al-Ḥamd al-ḥaqīqī laka minka yā ḥamīd yā majīd, fa-innamā majāz ḥamdinā takhyīl istiʻārah fī iṭlāq al-tajrīd, wa-rashshiḥ Allāhumma asrāranā bi-an taḍmura fī nufūsinā shuhūd waḥdatik al-aṣlīyah maʻa istiʻmālinā fī mursal tabʻīyat mursalika fī bayān al-ʻalāqāt al-marḍīyah, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-sallama wa-sharrafa wa-majjada wa-karram. Āmīn. Ammā baʻd, fa-yaqūlu Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī al-Azʹharī: Hādhā mā narjū Allāh taʻālá fīhi ʻalá sharḥ Shaykhinā wa-shaykh mashāyikhinā wa-mashāyikhihim al-ʻAllāmah al-Mullawī ʻalá al-istiʻārāt ..."
Secundo folio: li-tashbīhihā bi-irtibāṭ al-ilṣāq.
16.5 x 22.5 cm; written surface: 10 x 18.5 cm; 24 lines per page.
Binding: Unbound (in 3 quires).
In medium size Maghribi script, in black ink, on white paper; some markings in red; the statements of al-Mullawī are preceded by the word "Qawluhu" (his statement) in red; catchwords.

The manuscript is wrapped in an issue of "al-Ādāb" Egyptian weekly periodical (ʻadad 94, yawm al-Ithnayn, 26 Ṣafar, sanat 1307 - 21 Uktūbir, sanat 1889, al-sanah al-thālithah). On the last page of the issue (page 472) is written in pencil the name of "Muḥammad Ramaḍān al-Madanī al-Kutubī" who seems to be the manuscripts dealer.

On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-baḥr al-fahhāmah farīd ʻaṣrihi wa-waḥīd dahrihi Sayyidinā wa-shaykh mashāyikhinā Sayyidī Muḥammad al-Amīr al-Miṣrī ʻalá al-Mullawī al-Ṣaghīr fī al-istiʻārāt."
Text: Folios 1b-21b; folios 22-24 are blank.
